result.heading: SIR LAURENCE OLIVIER AND VIVIEN LEIGH

direction.raw_text: . TILBURY DOCKS. DAY. 1 Over a DARK SCREEN we see the caption: "This is a fairy story, an episode out of time and space, which nevertheless was real" - Colin Clark. Then, FADE UP ON: Newsreel footage of SIR LAURENCE OLIVIER AND VIVIEN LEIGH arriving back at Tilbury Docks to be greeted by an excited crowd of fans. As they progress down the gangplank and stop to sign autographs we HEAR an excited commentary OVER:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Returning to England are Britain's acting royalty Sir Laurence Olivier and Lady Olivier, better known as stunning Gone With The Wind star Vivien Leigh. Sir Laurence has added a new string to his bow with the announcement that he is to direct and star in a screen version of Terence Rattigan's stage play The Sleeping Prince with none other than Hollywood siren Marilyn Monroe. When the world's greatest actor romances the most famous woman alive, we can be sure that sparks will fly. Now, now Lady Olivier, don't worry - any romance is strictly for the camera!" As OLIVIER and VIVIEN smile for the photographers, we -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SALTWOOD CASTLE. DAY. 2 It is 1956. Saltwood Castle, the family home of the Clark family, looms over the landscape, framed by the setting sun. It is majestic, an Englishman's dream of a home, complete with turrets and even a moat. There is a feeling of timeless beauty and stability about the scene, something profoundly English. We are a very long way from Hollywood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SALTWOOD CASTLE. GARDEN. DAY. 3 COLIN CLARK, 23, hurries across the lawn carrying a bag, he is casually dressed, boyish and handsome. He heads towards a beautiful, ramshackle building and through the ancient oak doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SALTWOOD CASTLE. LIBRARY STAIRS. DAY. 3A COLIN bounds up the stairs into the Library.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SALTWOOD CASTLE. LIBRARY. DAY. 3B As COLIN enters, he sees SIR KENNETH CLARK, standing in front of a painting on an easel by the Italian Baroque painter, Annibale Carracci. He has two STUDENTS with him, a man and a woman in their early 20s, and is in mid-description of the painting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and this is one of Carracci's earlier works and one is able to see the emergence of his now famous Baroque style, which is clearly rooted in the tradition of high renaissance and antiquity...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pauses briefly and hurries towards them. Throughout the scene there is a sense of his urgency and desire to go. The whole thing should be played at breakneck pace. KENNETH beams affectionately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colin! Come in. Have you met James and Anna? Two very brilliant pupils. He has the avuncular air of a benign academic, affable and a little eccentric. COLIN smiles hurriedly at the students, no time to waste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm leaving for London now, Pa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, yes. Well, bon chance, dear boy... He puts a friendly arm around COLIN's shoulder and starts to walk him back to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can always get you a research position at the V&A when you've grown up a bit and got this film idea out of your system... COLIN's smiles but before he can reply JANE CLARK whirls into the room, a ball of energy, talking nineteen to the dozen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kenneth, you might have told Cook we were another two for dinner. What is everyone supposed to eat? Cabbage soup? Oh, Colin, darling, there you are...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She looks wonderful in a good quality but elderly dress, eccentrically combined with gardening attire, her mind on a dozen things at once.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm off now, Mama.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Off?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My job interview, remember..? But she is already continuing her journey. COLIN smiles hurriedly at KENNETH, who gives him an affectionate wave as
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: dashes after his mother. She leaves the Library.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SALTWOOD CASTLE. GARDEN. DAY. 3C JANE strides across the lawn with COLIN rushing to catch up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't you stay for dinner? There's nothing to eat but I'm sure the conversation will be charming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to be late in the morning. As COLIN hurries after JANE he is nearly run down by an elderly GARDENER with a lawn mower, and has to take lightning evasive action. JANE doesn't notice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure they won't mind. You'll be a famous film director in no time. I know your father's put in a word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish he hadn't done that. I can manage on my own. She stops so abruptly he nearly slams into her. JANE looks around the garden with a frown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to watch Jenkins like a hawk. One more of his murderous prunings and we'll lose the tea roses for ever. And she's off again, with COLIN still following. He can't help smiling at the madness of it all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SALTWOOD CASTLE. DRIVEWAY. DAY. 4 The sun is setting, casting a golden glow over the castle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and JANE emerge from the front door, COLIN pauses in the driveway and dumps his bag in the back of his old but racy MG Sports car. Only now does JANE really turn her attention fully to him for the first time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now go and have a lovely time, darling. We're always here when you're ready to talk your future.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wants to protest but before he can get the words out
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sees a YOUNG GARDENER walking at the side of the house with a wheel barrow. Her face lights up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mullins! Be an angel - find Cook and ask her how many pork chops we need for tonight. Then bring the car round. I must get to the village before the shop shuts... She dashes away after the GARDENER, turning back as an afterthought to blow a kiss at COLIN as she goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles, then pauses for a moment to look at the house. We can sense both his affection for it but more pressingly his need to get away. He gets in, puts the car in gear and the Bristol pulls out of the drive and across the moat. In the last rays of the sun, the countryside looks magical, but Colin only has eyes for the road ahead.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: AS HE MAKES HIS WAY INTO THE CITY WE SEE THE STATUE OF EROS AGAINST THE LIGHTS OF PICCADILLY CIRCUS, CROWDS MILLING AROUND TRAFALGAR SQUARE, YOUNG PEOPLE SPILLING OUT OF CLUBS AND COFFEE BARS IN SOHO, UNTIL, WE FADE TO

direction.raw_text: . LONDON STREETS MONTAGE. EVENING 5 CUT TO CREDITS OVER A MONTAGE OF SCENES OF LONDON IN THE 1950s FROM COLIN'S POINT OF VIEW. AS HE MAKES HIS WAY INTO THE CITY WE SEE THE STATUE OF EROS AGAINST THE LIGHTS OF PICCADILLY CIRCUS, CROWDS MILLING AROUND TRAFALGAR SQUARE, YOUNG PEOPLE SPILLING OUT OF CLUBS AND COFFEE BARS IN SOHO, UNTIL, WE FADE TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PICCADILLY STREETS. DAY. 6 A sharp contrast with the hazy beauty of the countryside. It is early morning in the heart of London's West End. The streets hum with activity as OFFICE WORKERS in hats and raincoats stream from the tube stations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pushes his way through the early morning crowds in Piccadilly. This is his patch; he is very much at home here, negotiating the busy streets with ease. As he passes by the upmarket Burlington Arcade a TAILOR pauses in measuring a suit for a client to give him a familiar wave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: waves back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 144 PICCADILLY. LONDON. DAY. 7 Checking his watch he runs the last few yards then stops outside the imposing facade of 144 Piccadilly. A plaque outside the door announces: LAURENCE OLIVIER PRODUCTIONS. Colin fingers his carefully knotted tie to make sure everything is correctly in place, then goes to the door and rings the bell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 144 PICCADILLY. RECEPTION AREA. DAY. 8 The reception area is luxurious - deep pile carpets and plush sofas. VANESSA, the beautiful secretary, sits behind her imposing desk, gazing doubtfully at COLIN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not in Mr. Perceval's diary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry told me to come. She pauses dubiously, then reaches for her telephone. We hear a man answer in an office down the hall, his voice carrying irritably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a Mr. Colin Clark here. He says Sir Laurence sent him. She stresses the proper name in disapproval of Colin's familiarity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, God... not another one of Vivien's pretty boys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at COLIN with amusement. His smile falters as he feels himself coming down to earth with a bump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 144 PICCADILLY. HUGH PERCEVAL'S OFFICE. DAY. 9 HUGH PERCEVAL (40s) is Laurence Olivier's production executive. He is tall and gloomy, with black-rimmed spectacles and thinning dark hair. He looks at COLIN grimly as he stuffs his pipe with tobacco.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, what do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A job on your Marilyn Monroe film.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh really, what as?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to work on the production side. He smiles with as much charm as he can muster. PERCEVAL isn't impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are no jobs yet. We don't start shooting for eight weeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I wait?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Until there's a job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For eight weeks?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something might come up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is distracted as the telephone rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terry? Larry wondered how the script was coming...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 144 PICCADILLY. RECEPTION AREA. DAY. (MONTAGE) 10 COLIN troops back to the sofa. VANESSA gives him a cool glance. COLIN looks at the clock. It has just gone 10.30.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We see the day pass as COLIN sits on the sofa - the clock ticking slowly on the wall, VANESSA busy at her desk, COLIN looking up hopefully from time to time, only to be disappointed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 144 PICCADILLY. RECEPTION AREA. DAY. (MONTAGE) 11 It is now nearly 6 o'clock. COLIN sits exactly as he was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shares a look with VANESSA as he comes out of his office. He gazes drily at Colin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are no jobs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll come back tomorrow morning. Just in case.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a free country. He sounds as though he rather regrets it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 144 PICCADILLY. LONDON. DAY. (MONTAGE) 11A COLIN arrives early, ready for another day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 144 PICCADILLY. RECEPTION AREA. DAY. (MONTAGE) 12 COLIN is back in his place at 8.30 sharp the next morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gives him a grim stare as he goes through to his office. VANESSA glances up from her typewriter. He meets her eye optimistically but she ignores him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 144 PICCADILLY. RECEPTION AREA. DAY. 13 The clock ticks around with agonising slowness to 11.00.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: finally gives Colin a pitying look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you going to sit there all day?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I have to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're very determined.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd do anything to be in the film business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She smiles cheekily. He grins back, sensing an opportunity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can start by making me a cup of tea. White, two sugars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 144 PICCADILLY. RECEPTION AREA. DAY. 15 Close on the clock as it ticks around monotonously to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .30. VANESSA puts on her gloves and collects her bag. She gives COLIN a sly look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can answer the telephone while I'm at lunch, if you like. She winks. COLIN grins. The phone rings. He picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laurence Olivier Productions...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is Sir Laurence there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's at Notley until the end of the week. Can I take a message?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll call back. No sooner has COLIN hung up than PERCEVAL appears. He stares at COLIN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vanessa asked me to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, did she? Why didn't you put that call through?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There didn't seem any need to bother you. But if you want me to transfer every single one...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at him grudgingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Use your judgement. He hesitates and looks back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need a number for Noel Coward. It won't be in the book, so you'll have to track him down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: realises this is a test. He thinks quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SALTWOOD CASTLE. HALL. DAY. 16 The phone rings in the beautiful central hall. JANE CLARK picks up the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Mama.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colin, darling! How are you getting on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RECEPTION AREA. DAY. 17 COLIN glances towards Perceval's office and talks quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is urgent. I need Noel Coward's London number. My life depends on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How exciting. Let me see... it's Sloane 2965. Ask him if he's coming to Saltwood for the bank holiday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will. Mama, you're an angel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 144 PICCADILLY. HUGH PERCEVAL'S OFFICE. DAY. 18 PERCEVAL looks up as COLIN puts the number on his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was quick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had a bit of luck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at him shrewdly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I supposed to be impressed? Did Mummy and Daddy help? Don't think they can do the job for you. The only way you'll get on in this business is through bloody hard work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 144 PICCADILLY. RECEPTION AREA. DAY. 19 A new morning. COLIN perches restlessly on the sofa. Despite his modest triumph he is back where he started. The seconds pass in dull silence. He is beginning to think his campaign will fail. But then, in a heartbeat, everything changes. He looks up in surprise as the door bursts open and SIR LAURENCE OLIVIER strides in with his wife VIVIEN LEIGH on his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . At the age of 49 SIR LAURENCE OLIVIER is at the peak of his fame. He is handsome and charismatic, and VIVIEN is scarcely less extraordinary. The Gone With The Wind star remains classically lovely, flirtatious and captivating. Individually they are charismatic enough, but together they are electrifying, seeming to charge the air around them with the power of their personalities, galvanising anyone who comes into contact with them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leaps to her feet and PERCEVAL hurries to greet them as COLIN stands up uncertainly. OLIVIER is all amiable bluster and bonhomie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know, Hughie, it is simply impossible to get Marilyn Monroe on the telephone? The darling girl spends the entire day asleep. But great beauty has its way... He laughs, but then notices VIVIEN's less than enthusiastic response. Seeking refuge in some distraction he notices
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hovering by the sofa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, boy... remind me? He smiles vaguely and glances at VIVIEN for help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You remember Colin, darling. You met him at the Clarks' party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. What are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said there might be a job on your film.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: has no recollection of this and fumbles in his pockets to cover his confusion, bringing out a packet of cigarettes and offering them to COLIN with breezy charm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have a cigarette. Keep the pack. He turns quickly to PERCEVAL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There won't be any film unless Miss Monroe gets her splendid posterior out of bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The House Committee are threatening to withhold Miller's passport. They say he's a communist. No Arthur, no Marilyn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll have a word with the American ambassador. I'm taking him to see Vivien in South Sea Bubble on Thursday... now, tell me, Hughie, are Terry's rewrites in? He puts an arm around PERCEVAL's shoulders and they disappear together into Perceval's office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lingers behind, smiling radiantly at COLIN who looks dumbly at the packet of cigarettes in his hand. He now sees they are called "Oliviers". VIVIEN wrinkles her nose in amusement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They named them after Larry. The first actor since Du Maurier to have his own brand and they pay him an absolute fortune. (Pause) I'm afraid they're rather ghastly. She cups Colin's cheeks with her hands and studies him in mock awe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't he gorgeous, Vanessa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I suppose he's all right. VIVIEN's eyes sparkle. OLIVIER emerges from the office with a handful of script pages and VIVIEN looks at him slyly, getting her own back for his tactless over-praise of Marilyn's charms as she strokes COLIN's cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's elope together and have the most glorious affair. (Arch) Oh, but then, who'd look after my poor Larry? Olivier glances over with a faint look of exasperation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: winks at COLIN and takes her husband's arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, darling, you must do something for Colin. You absolutely promised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks hunted. There is no way out. He glances back at PERCEVAL as he comes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's try to find him something to do, Hughie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: grins in triumph. VIVIEN smiles at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will take care of my precious Larrykins, won't you? She flirtatiously offers up her cheek for COLIN to kiss. COLIN's smile falters as he sees PERCEVAL looking at him grimly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 144 PICCADILLY. HUGH PERCEVAL'S OFFICE. DAY. 20 COLIN stands eagerly at PERCEVAL's desk. PERCEVAL looks at him, more than usually brusque.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur Jacobs, Miss Monroe's publicist is flying in tomorrow. He wants to see the house she'll be staying in. Find something suitable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 144 PICCADILLY. HUGH PERCEVAL'S OFFICE. DAY. ALT 20 COLIN knocks and walks into Perceval's office, carrying a tray with tea and a plate of biscuits. The blinds are closed and a 16mm projector is running; silent images play on a fold- up screen in the corner of the room. Framed in the light of the projector are PERCEVAL and the film's lighting cameraman JACK CARDIFF. They take no notice of Colin. He looks up at the screen. The two men are watching make-up, hair and wardrobe tests for the film. MARILYN MONROE in character as Elsie Marina.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The film shows Marilyn looking sweet and pretty, chatting silently to someone just off camera, mugging playfully in costume, larking about with her hair - and then, when she wants to, turning on her full film star wattage and looking wonderful, every inch the beautiful icon. It is an intimate glimpse of her at work. Colin watches, fascinated, completely forgetting why he's there, still holding the tray -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry says he particularly likes this dress. She looks radiant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly - we need to tone her down a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How the hell do you tone down Marilyn Monroe?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: laughs. He immediately regrets it. Both men turn to look at him. PERCEVAL turns off the projector and gazes at him stonily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn Monroe's publicist is flying in tomorrow. He wants to see the house she'll be staying in. Find something suitable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods eagerly, anxious to get out. He is already at the door when PERCEVAL barks at him again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And leave the bloody tea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: had forgotten the tray. He blushes furiously, puts it down and hurries out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COUNTRY ROAD. DAY. 21 COLIN has a map spread out on the bonnet of his Bristol sports car. He finds Pinewood Studios then draws a ring around its circumference. He taps his pencil thoughtfully as he lights a cigarette - one of the branded pack that Olivier gave him. He inhales deeply, thinking, then grimaces in distaste, quickly stubbing it out under his foot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TIBBS FARM. DRIVE. DAY. 22 COLIN pulls into the drive of Tibbs Farm, a charming English cottage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TIBBS FARM. DAY. 23 COTES-PREEDY, the owner, clearly has a very high opinion of Tibbs Farm. Aloof and snobbish, he stands by the front door, looking down his nose at COLIN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out of the question. I can't have a lot of awful film people tramping through the house in dirty boots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'd pay a hundred pounds per week for 18 weeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My wife would never agree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a pity. I'll have to tell Miss Monroe to look elsewhere, then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: double takes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn Monroe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's making a film with Sir Laurence Olivier. The Sleeping Prince. From the play by Terence Rattigan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw it in the West End a couple of years ago. Vivien Leigh was marvellous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Marilyn Monroe in the film.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles transparently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (After a second) I suppose I'd have to be introduced..?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 144 PICCADILLY. LONDON. DAY. 25 ARTHUR JACOBS, Marilyn's publicist, is a close-cropped, pugnacious figure in his mid-forties. He waits impatiently outside Olivier's office, a stack of newspapers under his arm. COLIN comes hurrying up, smiling brightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning, Mr. Jacobs. I hope you had a pleasant flight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the fucking car?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COUNTRY LANE. DAY. 26 JACOBS sits in the passenger seat of Colin's Bristol sports car reading his stack of newspapers. After a moment he grunts in disgust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeez, do you Brits actually read this stuff? He winds down his window and simply throws the whole lot out into the lane. The pages billow out in a great cloud behind the speeding car, landing in the pretty hedgerows and on neat front lawns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gapes in astonishment. Welcome to Hollywood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TIBBS FARM. DAY. 27 JACOBS slouches out of the house, magnificently unimpressed. COTES-PREEDY follows him proudly with COLIN at his side. JACOBS takes a long, unimpressed look at the property.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this place? A brothel? COTES-PREEDY's face falls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's one of the best houses in the area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus. And I thought you Brits had taste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He glances at COLIN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this the best you can do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's very near Pinewood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. We'll take it. (Pause) But ditch the wallpaper. It's given me a migraine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 144 PICCADILLY. HUGH PERCEVAL'S OFFICE. DAY. 28 JACOBS slaps down a copy of the Evening Standard on the desk. The front page carries a picture of Tibbs Farm with the caption: "Exclusive - Marilyn's Luxury Home In England". He jabs a finger at it angrily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: News travels fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That house was perfect for Marilyn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't use it now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes we can. I knew Cotes-Preedy wouldn't be able to keep this quiet. They stare to him in surprise. He looks at them boldly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you asked me to find a house for Miss Monroe I took the precaution of finding two. The other one, Parkside, is much better and the owner is very discreet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But now we have two expensive houses when we only wanted one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought someone else on the production might want it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, did you? There is a dangerous moment when things could go either way. COLIN has gambled everything in a bid to impress them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He waits in tense silence, staring at their puzzled expressions. But then JACOBS shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess Milton could use it. It's near the studio, near Marilyn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at COLIN, then bursts out laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are we paying you, boy? He glances at COLIN with amusement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See to it, Hughie!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sighs grimly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. DAY. 29 Pinewood studios is the glamorous heart of the British film industry. COLIN drives up to the gate and smiles at the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colin Clark. Sir Laurence Olivier Productions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. DAY. 30 ACTORS in full costume walk past, TECHNICIANS move lights and cameras, EXTRAS are herded to their scenes by harried
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COLIN takes it all in with wondering eyes. To him the studio is a magical place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. DRESSING ROOMS. DAY. 31 The dressing rooms are little more than empty shells.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks around. OLIVIER and PERCEVAL are with him, while COLIN waits attentively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The set decorators will have it all sorted out in no time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn hates red. And blue. (Pause) And green.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about white?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd have to clear it with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: glances mischievously at Colin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beige, then. Beige is rarely controversial.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: considers this, unaware that Olivier is teasing him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess that's okay. She's never said nothing about beige. Paula will need the room next door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paula?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Strasberg. Marilyn's acting coach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at him darkly. JACOBS shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's nuts about the Method.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stanislavski and the Method are perfectly fine in the rehearsal room but they don't belong on a film set. Time is too tight. I'm sure Marilyn understands. He turns and walks away. JACOBS frowns uncertainly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who the hell is this Commie Stan Slavski?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. PRODUCTION OFFICE. DAY. 32 COLIN stands in the Production Office. DAVID ORTON (30s) the First Assistant Director, a thin, fair-haired man regards him with obvious irritation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know why Hugh Perceval sent you here. There's nothing I can do for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you in the union?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then you can't have a job on the film.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do I get in the union?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By getting a job on the film.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you just said I couldn't have a job on the film unless I was in the union.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly. It's called a closed shop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at him helplessly. ORTON relents a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I suppose I might be able to sort something out. The Union owes me a few favours. We haven't got a third yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A third?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Third Assistant Director. (Pause) You do know what the job is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Assisting the director?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ, no! That's the last thing you do. Lesson One. The third's job is to do whatever the fuck I tell him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks to the door, then looks back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you waiting for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: scrambles to follow him out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. WARDROBE DEPT. DAY. 33 As ORTON and COLIN pass the wardrobe department COLIN notices a pretty WARDROBE GIRL (LUCY) putting costumes on the racks. She has dark hair and laughing eyes and is a year or so younger than him. ORTON follows his gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colin!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: jumps as ORTON glowers at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lesson Two. You don't shit on your own doorstep. Got it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got it. But he sneaks a look back at LUCY as he goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. DAY. 33A ORTON and COLIN hurry through Pinewood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you staying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My father's place in the Albany.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can forget that. Lesson Three. The Third always stays nearby, not in some bloody palace in London. (Pause) Book a room at the Dog And Duck down the road. It's a bit rough but you'll get used to it. He grins, enjoying himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now make yourself useful. Marilyn needs a bodyguard. Sort something out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. PRODUCTION OFFICE. DAY. 34 PERCEVAL sits with COLIN and ROGER SMITH. SMITH is a dignified figure in his mid-fifties. His erect bearing speaks of a lifetime in the police.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure you understand the sensitive nature of the job, Superintendant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No need for the title. I'm retired from the force. (Pause) Something about looking after a cinema actress?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not just any actress. Marilyn Monroe. He gets no reaction from the stolid ex-policeman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never had much time for the pictures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excellent. (Pause) For the next four months you never leave her side, day or night. There will be crowds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That doesn't bother me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pauses awkwardly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her behaviour is reputedly a little... erratic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She drinks?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amongst other things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pills?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leaves a tactful pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It would be useful if you could keep us informed of her... domestic situation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want me to spy on her? Perceval and Roger understand each other perfectly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just the odd early warning if you know she's going to be late on set. That kind of thing. Smith takes this in his stride; he seems wholly immune to the glamour of the movies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. CORRIDOR. DAY. 35 JACOBS chases after OLIVIER trying to get his attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is busy studying preliminary sketches of costumes and set.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need to speak to the Coca-Cola people, Larry. They're crazy to be involved with Marilyn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and COLIN meet them coming the other way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good news. The House Committee have decided Miller isn't a communist after all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course he is. All those pain in the ass New York intellectuals are reds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rolls his eyes behind JACOBS back. COLIN grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It means Marilyn will be flying in next week on schedule.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll have to be met.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naturally, Vivien and I will be there to greet her. But let's keep it low key, shall we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. I've got it all under control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LONDON AIRPORT. HALL. DAY. 36 Bedlam! The customs areas is besieged by shouting, pushing
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the POLICE fight to keep control. In the middle of the chaos COLIN stands with ROGER SMITH watching
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and VIVIEN addressing the gathered press.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is a deep happiness to me to be translating Terence Rattigan's magnificent play to the screen... A voice suddenly rings out from the back of the previously attentive crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The plane's landed! As one, the entire crowd turns away from Olivier and rushes towards the plane. Suddenly abandoned, OLIVIER and VIVIEN look momentarily startled before VIVIEN glances at him with a half-smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It seems we're not top of the bill anymore, darling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LONDON AIRPORT. PLANE/TARMAC. DAY. 37 MARILYN MONROE walks down the steps of a TWA jet on a rainy London day. She clutches a bouquet of flowers and wears
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . her raincoat is slung loosely over her shoulders. Her new husband ARTHUR MILLER walks a step or two behind her, wearing a light summer jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LONDON AIRPORT. TARMAC. DAY. 38 MARILYN and MILLER walks across the tarmac towards the terminal and the crowd of PRESS waiting for them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There she is! Marilyn! The REPORTERS surge forward. COLIN follows their collective gaze. She looks exactly as she should. The radiant smile, the platinum blonde hair, the sexy wiggle. The most famous film star in the world, so much herself it is almost unreal. Walking through the crowd MARILYN smiles easily, whereas
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks stern and a little dazed by the sudden flurry of attention. Flashbulbs pop as the POLICE struggle to contain the crowd. MARILYN puts her arm around MILLER, who grins blankly. The flashbulbs burst in front of them, a solid wall of dazzling light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn! Over here, Marilyn!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn, this way..!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: observes the chaotic scenes with obvious relish, grinning towards ROGER and COLIN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beautiful. You're looking at tomorrow's front page, boys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at COLIN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to get them to the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: barges his way through the scrum behind ROGER and briefly finds himself directly in front of MARILYN. For a moment he is transfixed by her beauty and charisma but she doesn't even see him as she follows the commanding ROGER obediently, tugging Miller along behind her, leaving Colin in her wake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LONDON AIRPORT. HALL. DAY. 40 MARILYN sits with MILLER at her side, flanked by OLIVIER and VIVIEN. MARILYN wears a large pair of sunglasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: jam their flashbulbs into her face. ROGER hovers protectively with COLIN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles as he addresses the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's my genuine pleasure to introduce a woman who needs no introduction. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A great actress on her first trip to London whom I have no doubt...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you like being married, Marilyn?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like it a lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this third time lucky?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bet it is. Arthur's the greatest man I ever met.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles tolerantly, mildly put out at this. MARILYN takes off her sunglasses and blinks. She takes MILLER's arm and looks at him adoringly. He bites down savagely on his unlit pipe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn, are you planning to see the sights?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd love to see the little fellow with the bow and arrow in Piccadilly Circus. There is a appreciative laughter from reporters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it true you want to be a classical actor now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to be the best actress I can be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a rumour you're going to be in The Brothers Karamazov on Broadway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm considering it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which of them will you be playing? The agenda is clear - Marilyn is the dumb blonde and should act accordingly. But she takes it in her stride, smiling sweetly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be playing Grushenka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you spell that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Can you? There is laughter at the reporter's expense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So would you say you're an intellectual now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My husband is. She looks adoringly at Miller, who smiles vaguely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your definition of an intellectual, Marilyn?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess you could look it up in a dictionary. This time the laughter is emphatically on MARILYN's side. One of the reporters turns to VIVIEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vivien, you created the part of Elsie Marina on stage. Do you have any advice for Marilyn?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am sure if Miss Monroe needs any advice she'll get it from her director. I hear he's terribly good. The reporters laugh with her and OLIVIER smiles graciously. But as she smiles at him we detect just a flicker of jealous hurt in her eyes. OLIVIER intervenes quickly to continue his prepared speech of welcome.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In The Sleeping Prince we have discovered the perfect vehicle for Miss Monroe's luminous and justly celebrated talent... He stops as a REPORTER shouts over him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn, is it true you wear nothing in bed except Chanel No
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As I'm in England let's say I sleep in nothing but Yardley's Lavender.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The press laugh in delight. On the edge of the crowd COLIN watches her, amused and impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. GATES. DAY 41 A convoy of cars pass through the throng of JOURNALISTS waiting at the gate. Marilyn's "secret" hideaway is no longer much of a secret. The classical old house is elegant and luxurious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. FRONT DOOR. DAY. 42 Outside the front door MARILYN, MILLER, OLIVIER and VIVIEN have their picture taken by the official PHOTOGRAPHER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watches unobtrusively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are all your press conferences like that, darling?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that was quieter than some. Vivien smiles at the wry joke. ARTHUR JACOBS watches the proceedings with an eagle eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, let's get a snap of the newlyweds. Smile, Arthur. It's not a firing squad. As the group breaks up, MILTON GREENE, handsome and dark- haired, now approaches OLIVIER and COLIN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is some place you found. He glances at the house. Olivier smiles generously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have my new assistant Colin to thank for that. (Pause, he shepherds COLIN over) This is Milton Greene. You must be very nice to him. He owns half of Marilyn Monroe Productions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forty nine per cent, Larry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: offers them a tired smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: produces one of his branded packets and offers a cigarette to Milton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't smoke. If he notices the "Olivier" name he doesn't show it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks mildly put out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Milton - Marilyn and rehearsals. Let's talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. And the studio wants a new title.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: escorts Milton away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and MARILYN are now being photographed on their own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: moves over to JACOBS and murmurs discreetly in his ear. JACOBS nods and moves in to end the session.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boys at the gate are getting restless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's give them two minutes and then we're done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: waves to the POLICEMEN, who open the gates. The PRESS come pouring in like a mob of revolutionaries storming the Bastille.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. FRONT DOOR. DAY. 43 COLIN notices Marilyn grip Miller's hand tightly as the flashbulbs pop all around her. A moment later he is surprised to find VIVIEN at his elbow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marvellous, isn't she? I suppose you're quite smitten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at her shrewdly, sensing he is being tested.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's all right. A bit common.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry fell desperately in love with her in New York. He's determined to seduce her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But she's only been married three weeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Colin, I thought you were a man of the world. She gives him an arch smile and leans in intimately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Of course, Larry would never leave me. (Pause) But, if anything were to happen, you would let me know, wouldn't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure he loves you very much. There is a flash of sudden anger in her expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, don't be such a boy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks shaken and she touches his hand in contrition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At least you still adore me, don't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. Everyone does. There is a wintry bleakness in her face for a second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm 43, darling. No one will love me for much longer. Not even you. He goes to protest but she stills him with a finger to his lips, her smile quickly restored.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DOG AND DUCK PUB. DAY. 44 The Dog and Duck is a rundown pub in an out of the way lane near the studios. It is a rough, local place utterly devoid of glamour or comfort. COLIN stands outside, staring at it grimly, his bag in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DOG & DUCK PUB. DAY 44A A few hard-core LOCALS stand nursing their pints at the bar. One is idly throwing darts. The wallpaper is faded yellow with cigarette smoke, stale sandwiches curl in a display case. COLIN looks around, his heart sinking. BARRY, the landlord looks him up and down, disparagingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colin Clark. I booked a room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: takes a dusty ledger from beneath the bar, spins it around for COLIN to sign.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What brings you up this way?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: can't help looking a little pleased with himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here working on a film. The LOCALS look up from their pints, unimpressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What film's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's called `The Sleeping Prince'. The darts player, ANDY, doesn't turn. His aim remains steady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds lousy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ignore, Andy - not a film fan - are you, Andy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: doesn't look away from his game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't be bothered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: tries to impress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn Monroe's in it. I'll be working with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, will you now? The regulars grin unkindly into their pints. ANDY doesn't look away from his game, as he offers laconically:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Queen and Prince Philip popped in for a pint earlier. Pity, you just missed them. There are supportive snorts of derision from the LOCALS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: takes it on the chin. BARRY hands him a key.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room's three quid a week, first week in advance. You're in number two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: takes the key and his bag, just as BARRY adds, with perfect deadpan timing:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll be sharing with Grace Kelly. The LOCALS laugh into their beer. COLIN smiles gamely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DOG AND DUCK PUB. COLIN'S ROOM. DAY. 45 COLIN stands aghast. He is staying in a grim little room above the noisy saloon bar. The wallpaper is peeling, the furniture is ancient and the whole place reeks of damp. Dirty net curtains flutter in the window. He puts his bag on the bed and sits down. The mattress sags pitifully. He looks down and finds a stained and yellowing chamber pot under the bed. He slides it back with a look of revulsion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 46 The principal cast of The Sleeping Prince, as it was still known at the time, assemble on the sound stage amongst the half-finished set. They chat and smoke, their scripts in their hands. OLIVIER stands in their midst, very much first amongst equals. One chair sits conspicuously unoccupied.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: , severe-looking but kindly, very much the grand dame of the gathering, smiles cheerfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leans over to her with a cheerful grin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a wonderful adventure, Dame Sybil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Such a lark! I long to see her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands by the door. OLIVIER looks at his watch and shoots him a questioning glance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. CORRIDOR/DRESSING ROOM. DAY. 47 COLIN hurries along the corridor and stops outside Marilyn's dressing room. He knocks on it politely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss Monroe? The door opens sharply and a small, bohemian looking woman in her 50s stands staring at him. This is PAULA STRASBERG.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir Laurence sends his compliments. He's ready for the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He glances beyond PAULA to where MARILYN sits by the mirror, her reflection framed in the lights. She wears little or no make-up. PAULA looks at him sharply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Marilyn is not ready. She's preparing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: glances up at COLIN in the mirror and smiles with unexpected simplicity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse the horrible face. She finds her dark glasses on the dresser and puts them on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. CORRIDOR. DAY. 48 COLIN leads MARILYN and PAULA to the rehearsal room. He sneaks a glance at her. She has a vulnerable, lost expression. COLIN can't help staring at her until he notices PAULA looking at him and quickly glances away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 49 The cast are all seated around the large table as COLIN leads MARILYN and PAULA onto the stage. Marilyn keeps her dark glasses on throughout. OLIVIER rises to greet her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn, here you are, everyone is so excited to meet you... He gestures to the company.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let us begin. Do sit down, please...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks sweetly at MARILYN from across the table and indicates the empty one at her side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How lovely you are. Here, I kept a place for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: bursts forward, steering Marilyn away instead to an empty seat on the other side of the rectangle of tables. She looks at RICHARD WATTIS, the actor occupying the seat next to the empty one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to be next to Marilyn! The startled WATTIS gets up graciously and troops all the way around the table to the seat next to SYBIL THORNDIKE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, dear, we won't bite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at her in truculent apology.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She likes me by her side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a good idea! I wish we could all bring a friend. One does get so terribly nervous. It's just like the first day at school, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She smiles kindly at MARILYN who smiles back tentatively from behind her dark glasses. He smiles with considerable charm as he makes his opening speech of welcome.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Welcome dear Marilyn, to our little fraternity. (Pause, looks around) We may seem a little strange and quaint to you at first, but I hope that in time you may come to find your method in our madness. Pleased with his over-contrived rhetorical flourish, he gives Paula a pointed look. She glowers back, obscurely sensing that she has been insulted in some way. MARILYN also looks up in confusion at Olivier's well intentioned but clumsy joke. Oblivious to her reaction, he opens his script with a sentimental flourish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So. My very noble and approv'd good masters, let us now embark on our great voyage of discovery together. (Pause) With boldness and (we pray) good fortune, may we strive to create a work of art that, led by your good graces, will be cherished as long as motion pictures may be remembered. He is momentarily close to tears. WATTIS rolls his eyes discreetly, earning a grin from the actor PAUL HARDWICK. There is a rustle of pages and a few coughs, a mood of eager nervousness in the air as they all prepare for the reading.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 50 Page 10. PAULA turns the pages of MARILYN's script for her, as though helping a child to read. OLIVIER is in full flow, employing a heavy Mittel European accent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Were you surprised to get my invitation?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at him for a beat then reads haltingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "I'll say I was surprised. I was so surprised I couldn't hardly think you meant me."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "oh but of course I meant you. I had your name most carefully marked down on my programme. In matters of this kind I assure you I am most methodical. Who did you think I meant if not you?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: drops out of character with a sweet, nervous smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gee, Mister Sir, I could listen to your accent all day. There are private grins amongst the actors. OLIVIER smiles kindly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are amongst friends, my darling angel. Just plain Larry will suffice. (Pause) When you're ready..? Flustered, MARILYN looks at her script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Well, Maisie Springfield...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Oh, no, no, no not Maisie Springfield, she's quite what I would call old hat...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leans across, mounting a whispered running commentary in Marilyn's ear as OLIVIER speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember why you're in the embassy, Marilyn. What does the Grand Duke want from Elsie? She thought there were going to be a lot of people here and it's just her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: waits patiently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's your line, Marilyn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, let's see... "Oh, and am I what you'd call new hat?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: tries to continue but is yet again brought up short by PAULA's passionate whispering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Locate the experience, Marilyn. Look for the memory that helps you. Remember when you went to that party at Chaplin's house and you were the only guest? How did that make you feel? This time OLIVIER stares at PAULA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is only a readthrough, Paula.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn has to begin finding the character.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The character is on the page.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The words, maybe. Not the character.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: whispers to PAUL HARDWICK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's half cut!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: frowns with regal disapproval and smiles warmly at MARILYN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aren't we going to have fun?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 51 The readthrough over, OLIVIER rails quietly at MILTON while
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: clears up the tea cups and plates used by the actors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't have two fucking directors!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn wants Paula.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? She's got me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paula is costing us two and half thousand bucks a week. We might as well use her. (Pause) Listen Larry, accept Marilyn on her own terms and you'll be okay. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Try to change her and she'll drive you crazy. Trust me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stalks away. COLIN takes a chance and follows him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dear Christ, what have I got myself into?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. WARDROBE DEPT. DAY. 52 COLIN follows LUCY the WARDROBE GIRL down a rack of clothes. He is charming, glib and persistent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come out with me tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm working.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tomorrow night, then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm washing my hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your hair's lovely. She stops to look at him, attracted but cautious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I have two rules. One, never touch the talent...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone has a lot of rules around here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and two, never go out with thirds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because they're all randy little buggers who just want some fun during shooting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not like that. She looks at him sceptically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm free on Saturday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colin!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ducks into a rack of clothes, making a face at Lucy. She can't help smiling back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. GATE. DAY. 53 First light over Pinewood Studios. Although it is August it is chilly so early in the morning. COLIN stands by the gate wearing only his thin summer jacket. He blows on his hands to keep warm. A black car appears. The window winds down and DAME SYBIL THORNDIKE pops her head out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How kind of you to meet us. Dear me, you do look cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're ready for you in make-up Dame Sybil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How exciting! Don't you love the first day of a new production?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, Dame Sybil. I've never had one before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gazes at him with wistful sadness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, to be young again! She blows him a kiss and the car rolls in through the gate. Almost immediately OLIVIER's chauffeur driven Bentley appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn here yet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. GATE. DAY. 54 COLIN looks anxiously down the empty road. DAVID ORTON strides towards him angrily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck's going on? I thought you had a contact in her house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well bloody use him, then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. FRONT DOOR. DAY. 55 ROGER greets COLIN on the doorstep with a grin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hasn't come down yet. Neither has Miller. They're playing trains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at him blankly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. DRAWING ROOM/PRODUCTION 56 OFFICE. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and MILTON sit in silence, studiously avoiding each other's eyes. Somewhere upstairs bed springs creek under the pressure of enthusiastic love-making. The phone rings. MILTON nods to COLIN to pick it up. COLIN is glad of the distraction. We hear ORTON's irate tones on the end of the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well? What's happening?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: glances upstairs as he tries to think what to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's... getting into character.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 57 Dame Sybil stands alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 58 RICHARD WATTIS, ROSAMUND GREENWOOD (MAUD) and TWO FOOTMAN in full costume, sweating under the hot lights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: prowls the set smoking impatiently. COLIN is at his side with DAVID ORTON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's kept Dame Sybil Thorndike waiting in full costume for two hours. It's simply not fair. The door finally opens and MARILYN emerges, with PAULA on one side and MILTON on the other. In her figure-hugging shimmering white sheath of a dress she is ravishingly beautiful. Her hair is like a halo of light around her head. No one can take their eyes off her. Slowly, all work on the set stops. MARILYN walks to the set, acutely aware of the scrutiny of the crew. She smiles nervously, then suddenly hesitates, feeling the weight of everyone's attention. Anxiety flits across her face. She whispers something to PAULA and bolts back towards her dressing room. OLIVIER stares after her in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wasn't happy with her make- up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: loosens his collar irritably and glances at ORTON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right, Mr. Orton you wanted me to check the back projection. Please join us, Mr. Cardiff. He stalks away, followed by Cardiff and Orton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 59 COLIN sees SYBIL THORNDIKE standing on set. She beams at him cheerfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't she pretty though?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like to sit down, Dame Sybil?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How kind of you, Colin. Yes, why don't we all sit down? Colin sees her chair by the camera and goes innocently to fetch it. But as he picks it up he is confronted by a stern looking crew member in overalls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you a member of NATTKE?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That chair is a prop. Props are
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . If ACT members are going to do NATTKE jobs, I'm calling my men out. Every eye is suddenly on Colin. Taking his shock for stubbornness TREVOR turns to the set and bellows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Strike meeting! Half the crew immediately down tools. COLIN looks on in horror. SYBIL THORNDIKE frowns in reproach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure we're all good union members here. There's no need to fall out over something so trivial.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It might be trivial to you, Dame Sybil, but it's my livelihood. He's not in the union. (Pause, to Colin) Put the chair down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at him, frozen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put the chair down now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: drops it as though it was on fire. It clatters to the stage. SYBIL THORNDIKE bears down on TREVOR majestically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I rather think you've made your point. Solidarity is the important thing here. When unions fall out, it's only management that benefits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pauses, not at all sure about this, but then shrugs magnanimously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I see you doing a NATTKE job again I'll close this set down quicker than you can blink. He turns to one of his men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dave, Dame Sybil needs a chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: picks up the same chair, moves it approximately six inches and places it behind SYBIL THORNDIKE, who finally sits down, her sunny good humour instantly restored.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was on the picket lines in
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: you know. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Now that was a strike. We were all Bolsheviks then! She smiles nostalgically as ORTON appears to hustle COLIN away, muttering furiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't they teach you anything at Eton? Now fuck off and see if you can get me a bacon sandwich without starting World War III.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 60 MARILYN is at last on set and ready to shoot. SYBIL THORNDIKE, as the Queen Dowager, waits behind a door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is in front of the camera with MARILYN, who flutters her hands nervously in an odd calming gesture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: mutters a last few words in her ear, reading her lines to her from her small brown notebook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watches intently. A bell rings and the red light goes on. The camera operator, DENYS, rolls the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Camera running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very quiet, everyone...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speed. The CLAPPER LOADER clicks the clapperboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty two, take one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Action!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Now, before you meet my mother- in-law I must warn you she is a little vague and can be very deaf... on occasions."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sweeps through the door right on cue, with
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: her lady-in-waiting, following. She is effortlessly in command of her lines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "My dear, such boredom! The decorations hideous, and the music... catastrophe! Our friend, the ex-King of Moravia drove me home. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT'D) He is now called the Duke of Strelitz, he cannot of course go to the Abbey tomorrow, but he is most anxious you should invite him to the room you have taken in the Ritz for Nicky. Maud?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Yes, Ma'am..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Oh there you are my dear, I did not see you, give me a glass of that champagne I see over there. Olga Bosnia..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Might I present Miss Elsie Marina?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Oh yes, my dear, of course I remember you well." They all look at MARILYN... and nothing happens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gee. I forgot my line. I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles cheerfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's so easily done, isn't it? I'm sure I went wrong somewhere there too. Shall we have another go, Larry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 61 The clapperboard snaps. Take Five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Oh yes, my dear, of course I remember you well."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (HALTING) "Oh, I'm quite sure you don't, your royal..., oh, I mean, your, uh, Imperial... your uh... serene majesty." It is not clear whether Marilyn's hesitance is acted or not but the others press on gamely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "What does she say?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "She says she is deeply flattered and compliments you on your wonderful memory."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: jumps in, shouting her line over the top of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "I'm in The Coconut Girl at The Avenue." There is a pause. SYBIL THORNDIKE hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't I have a line somewhere there, dear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 62 The clapperboard snaps shut again. Take twelve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Action!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Thank you, my dear. (Pause) Sweetly pretty. She should use more mascara. When one is young one should use a lot of mascara, and when one is old one should use much more. What do you do, my dear?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "I'm in The Coconut Girl at The Avenue".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (TO OLIVIER) "Dear?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "She says she is an actress."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at him, hesitant but just about in character.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: glances at ORTON who nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut it there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Check the gate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (After a second) Gate's good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Print. There is a near-audible sigh of relief around the set.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was perfect, Marilyn. You're Elsie to the life!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles awkwardly, not really believing her but
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: carries on with complete conviction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Perhaps we could practise our lines together later? You'd be doing me such a kindness. At my great age it's just so hard to make them stick! Why don't you come for tea tomorrow? In fact Sybil is word perfect every time, and everyone knows it. But it is a kind and tactful gesture. MARILYN's face lights up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 62A OLIVIER looks at COLIN in dismay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's impossible. I should have cast Vivien.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If anyone can make her great, it's you. You're a genius.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yes. The world's greatest living actor, so they say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at him, wanting to be reassured. He fumbles for a cigarette with shaking fingers and COLIN hurries to light it. He smiles wryly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's hope I'm as brilliant as you think I am. (Pause) Now be a good boy and keep an eye on her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD. DRESSING ROOMS/CORRIDOR. DAY. 63 MARILYN and PAULA are heading for the dressing room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks tired and disconnected. COLIN is just behind them on another errand. He can't help overhearing Paula's insistent, honeyed tones as she responds to Marilyn's uncertainty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just can't figure this movie out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were wonderful. You are the most gifted actress I have ever known. You were superb, Marilyn. You were divine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was angry with me, I could tell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were great. You are a great, great actress. All my life I have prayed for a great actress I could help and guide. She stops abruptly and gets down on her knees in the corridor in front of Marilyn. COLIN stops awkwardly, his path blocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like this. I prayed to God on my knees. And he has given me you. You are that great actress, Marilyn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Paula, get up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not until you admit you were great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles, her mood slowly lightening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, okay. I guess I was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: glances at her, seeing his chance to help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really were very good, Miss Monroe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles vaguely. PAULA gives him a fierce look - COLIN moves past quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAFE DE PARIS. LONDON. NIGHT. 64 The mood in the Club is cosmopolitan, lively but elegant. Rows of small tables are arranged around the stage, a few young couples are dancing to a jazz trio playing an exuberant, upbeat number. The music comes to an end and the couples return to their tables, COLIN and LUCY among them. There is champagne on the table, COLIN pours them both a glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure you can afford all this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, it's all right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It must be costing a week's wages.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's worth it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: can't help being charmed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not the average third, are you? Most of them would be happy with a swift half and a grope in the pub car park.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not living off my parents, if that's what you mean. I want to make my own way, no matter what.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By making eyes at Vivien Leigh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who told you that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Word gets around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vivien's a friend of my father's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So there's nothing in it? You and Vivien? He smiles mysteriously and leans in to kiss her. She avoids him coolly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not that easy. The WAITER approaches with a bill on a silver salver and offers him a pen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll be signing on your father's account, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: blushes violently.
direction.name: direction
