direction.raw_text: Certainly not. I settle my own bills. The WAITER nods discreetly and leaves. LUCY looks at COLIN with a teasing smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was always going to pay, you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course you were. He looks at her, but there is no hint of mockery in her smile and he is grateful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think Marilyn is beautiful?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not compared to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: laughs, COLIN looks hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have to try so hard to be charming. You're nice enough as it is. Well, you could be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She touches his hand and takes a drag from his cigarette as he refills her glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know Marilyn's really still in love with Joe DiMaggio?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So they say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She married Miller on the rebound. The papers are calling them "The Hourglass and the Egghead".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which one is which? She bursts out laughing. Her eyes sparkle and she looks captivating in the glistening lights. He goes to kiss her and this time she doesn't stop him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LUCY'S HOUSE. SUBURBS. NIGHT. 65 Colin's Bristol is drawn up in a quiet suburban road lined with pleasant semi-detached houses. Lucy's house has a neat patch of front lawn, a stolid family car in the drive and net curtains in the windows. It is very little different from any of its neighbours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LUCY'S HOUSE. PARLOUR. NIGHT. 65A COLIN and LUCY are kissing in the small "best" parlour at the front of the house. It is spotlessly neat and clean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: touches Lucy's breasts and then opens the buttons of her blouse. She puts her hand on his, stopping him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a while, crocodile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I really do like you, Lucy. She looks at him shrewdly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe. She hears heavy footsteps in the bedroom above.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's my dad. She gives Colin a swift peck on the cheek as she tidies herself. A moment later the door opens and Lucy's father, MR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes in, wearing his dressing gown over pyjamas. He glances at COLIN with a suspicious smile as he looks at his daughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ARMSTRONG Time to be thinking about bed, darling. Early start tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, Daddy. We were just going over tomorrow's schedule.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and LUCY share a small, private smile. He takes his cue and stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I should be off. Colin Clark. Pleased to meet you, Mr. Armstrong. He offers the surprised MR. ARMSTRONG a confident handshake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a very nice house you've got.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ARMSTRONG Do you know this part of the world?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Umm... not really. My family are more country people. Lost for words they stare at each other for another moment before MR. ARMSTRONG smiles vaguely then goes. LUCY follows him with a smile at COLIN. He grins and whispers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Next Saturday? She nods. He follows her out into the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LUCY'S HOUSE. SUBURBS. NIGHT. 65B As he walks down the path, COLIN pauses. He looks around at the uniform semi-detached houses all around him. He is uncomfortable here, so far from the glamorous world of his parents or Pinewood studios. He has a strong sense that he and Lucy are from very different worlds, and walks to his car with an uneasy sense of relief to be getting away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. GATE. DAY. 66 COLIN is back on the early morning watch. A black car draws up and SYBIL THORNDIKE leans out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colin, dear, I thought you looked cold so I bought you this. She hands him a bright red woollen scarf. COLIN is touched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Dame Sybil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Film sets and rehearsal rooms are the coldest places on earth. He smiles as her car drives away. He wraps the scarf around his neck and looks up and down the road again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 67 The crew stand around in sullen discontent. OLIVIER paces back and forth with MILTON at his side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She should be on time, like everyone else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is a star.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a fucking star! He looks around in frustration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we nip this behaviour in the bud perhaps it won't be repeated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Marilyn you're talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: scowls at COLIN, who gives him a cigarette. MARILYN finally emerges with PAULA at her elbow. OLIVIER advances on her, his anger simmering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn, darling you are an angel, and I kiss the hem of your garment, but why can't you get here on time for the love of fuck?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... you have that word in England too? She looks at him in surprise. She looks sedated, not quite there. PAULA leaps protectively to her defence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn has to prepare properly. She has to find in herself all that lies under the surface. Acting isn't just a case of putting on a costume or some ludicrous false nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gives her a freezing look then takes Marilyn's hand, leading her forward like a child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must apologise to Dame Sybil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: reddens with humiliation as he takes her arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 68 OLIVIER propels MARILYN towards SYBIL THORNDIKE. MARILYN reddens with humiliation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Cutting her off) My dear, you mustn't concern yourself. A great actress like you has many other things on her mind. A radiant smile spreads slowly across Marilyn's face as the older woman's words sink in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I'm a great actress?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: None of the rest of us truly know how to act for the camera. But you do. It is a rare gift. She looks sharply at OLIVIER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) This poor girl hasn't had your years of experience. She is in a strange country, acting a strange part. Now, are you helping or bullying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks aghast at being so roundly rebuked. COLIN looks on, startled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. VIEWING THEATRE. DAY. 69 OLIVIER, MILTON, PERCEVAL, ORTON and the editor JACK HARRIS watch rushes. COLIN lurks about unnoticed at the back. They watch one of OLIVIER's speeches (from the " The Coconut Girl" sequence we saw filming in Scenes 61 and 62). He is dry and clipped, every take precise and professional. It is an effective but theatrical performance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sneaks in with ARTHUR MILLER. They sit in the back row watching her performance from the same scene. She fluffs take after take, gets her words wrong and pauses, looking dazed. COLIN notices her clutching MILLER's hand tightly. But finally a good take comes up. She is charming and natural and her performance suddenly makes OLIVIER's look stiff and clumsy. MILLER smiles in relief and reassurance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That one's pretty damn good. You knocked it out of the park.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: glows at his praise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When Marilyn gets it right you just don't want to look at anyone else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: frowns. For all his greatness as an actor he will never be a film star like the maddeningly instinctive Marilyn. And the injustice of it is like a stab through his heart. At the back COLIN only has eyes for the screen. He watches MARILYN's image, enthralled. Until now he has taken Marilyn entirely at Olivier's valuation, but as he watches her on screen he begins to see things differently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He sneaks a look at her in real life. She is holding MILLER's hand tightly, looking tense and vulnerable as one disastrous take follows another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. CORRIDOR. DAY. 70 COLIN comes out of the viewing theatre behind OLIVIER and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've only been shooting for four days and we're already two weeks behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: can't resist blurting out a comment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not only show her the good takes? Then she might feel better about herself. He looks self-conscious as they both turn to stare at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The kid's right. She could use the confidence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe it's traditional for the producer of the film to watch rushes. Besides, she's an experienced actress. She should learn from her mistakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They just upset her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not half as much as they upset me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 71 COLIN hurries across the stage, carrying a fresh carton of "Oliviers". ORTON stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll do that. You go and find Marilyn's script. She thinks she left it in her dressing room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. MARILYN'S DRESSING ROOM. 72 DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: bursts into the dressing room without knocking. Clothes are strewn carelessly all over the floor. There are pill bottles, full and empty, on every surface, along with empty bottles of champagne and bunches of flowers. COLIN rummages around on the table, moving piles of scripts and books. No luck. He walks casually through the half-open door into the inner chamber. And stops dead in his tracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands by a chair, a towel wrapped around her head. She is completely naked. She looks at him in astonishment. He stares back, equally astounded. He sees her script, heavily covered in handwritten notes, lying on the table next to an open bottle of champagne and a bottle of pills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your script...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I found it. Calmly she takes the towel from her hair and wraps it around herself. She smiles quizzically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can go now, Colin. He hesitates a beat, surprised that she knows his name, before he fumbles for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. MARILYN'S DRESSING 73 ROOM/CORRIDOR. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: slams the door, aghast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. WARDROBE DEPT. DAY. 74 COLIN and LUCY are buried in the clothes racks kissing passionately. They surface for air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: David wants to know if you're ready for the extras in the ballroom scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell him he can start sending them up. Women first. They kiss again. He pulls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm looking forward to Saturday. He looks at her uncertainly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our date?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I forgot. I can't do Saturday. Marilyn wants to go shopping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Since when do you work for her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry asked me to help out. She smiles sardonically, teasing him, but a little hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, of course you must do what Larry says.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Next Friday instead? She shrugs in agreement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll pick you up. Eight o'clock. He smiles, a little too glibly, and hurries away. LUCY gazes after him. He doesn't look back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LONDON. MARILYN'S CAR. DAY. 75 COLIN sits in the front with ROGER driving. MARILYN, ARTHUR MILLER and MILTON GREENE sit in the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LONDON. BOND STREET. DAY. 76 It is very quiet in the normally busy West End. Shops have begun shutting after lunch and the city is rapidly emptying. SHOPPERS wander past, taking little notice of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who has her hair covered in a scarf and wears dark glasses. MILLER walks at her side, holding her hand. She glances at MILTON with an awkward laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gee, it's quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Saturday. Early closing. But they're expecting us. She stops to window shop. MILTON lowers his voice to COLIN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one's recognised her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At least she can shop in peace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn's a star. Stars don't even pee alone. He looks around anxiously. But then a PASSER-BY suddenly narrows his eyes and takes a second look. His face lights up and he shouts -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Marilyn Monroe!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gives him a radiant smile and within seconds is surrounded by a crowd of SHOPPERS alerted by the fuss. A feverish excitement grows out of nothing as people come running to look, pushing and shoving to see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is quickly hemmed in by the heaving mob. To begin with she enjoys it, smiling and posing happily for the cameras that appear out of nowhere. But as the crowd press towards something in the mood of the gathering changes; it becomes wild and over-excited mood as people scream Marilyn's name and shove bits of paper to sign in her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is pushed to the ground and MARILYN is forced back against the shop window. COLIN sees a flicker of panic on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God, she'll be torn apart...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get her out of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and ROGER hurl themselves into the crowd doing what they can to keep the excited fans at bay. They manage to force a path to the car, drag the door open and bundle MARILYN and MILLER into the back. MARILYN is pinned against the door and COLIN has to put his arm around her shoulders as he helps her in. He hurls himself into the front, with Milton running alongside the moving car to dive in beside Marilyn. People run alongside, hammering wildly on the windows in violent hysteria.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: does his best to put a cheerful gloss on the chaos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeez, Marilyn, they really fucking love you. As COLIN looks in the rear-view mirror he sees MILLER shaking his head in dazed horror as MARILYN slumps half-collapsed into the seat beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madness. Someone's going to get hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shifts his gaze to her in the mirror and his eyes meet Marilyn's. He sees - or imagines - a terrible sadness before she quickly replaces her dark glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 77 COLIN stands silently by the camera, watching MARILYN and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in character as Elsie Marina and Northbrook, open the doors of the Grand Duke's drawing room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Well we're still the first ones, aren't we? Gee, this is all right, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks out from behind the camera, patient and charming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut. The line is "Gee, this is all right too, isn't it". It's a tiny word, my darling, but it matters. Let's go straight away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles vaguely. HAIR and MAKE-UP rush to do last minute checks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Camera running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark it. The clapperboard clatters down. Take two. WATTIS and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: come in again on their cue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Well we're still the first ones, aren't we? Gee, this is all right, isn't it?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut. Nearly there, but Terry did work so very hard on this and we must try to get it right for him. Straight away, please. Take three.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Well, we're still the first ones, aren't we? Gee, this is... all right, isn't it?" By now there is a panic-stricken edge to her voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't we just drop it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The point is that you have already admired the downstairs hall in an earlier scene. Now you are admiring this room as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, sure. (Pause, she looks stricken) Paula!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks startled. PAULA comes scurrying across.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: appeals to her, turning away from OLIVIER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't get it. He's such a strange man. I think she'd figure out he only invited her to sleep with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The reason Marilyn can't remember the line is because she doesn't believe the situation her character is in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: takes out all his pent-up frustration on PAULA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then she should pretend to believe it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: bristles at this insult to her husband's work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretend? We're talking about the difference between the truth and artificial crap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're in absolute agreement, Paula. Acting is all about sincerity. And if you can fake that, you're off to the races.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: only stares at him in disgust. Thoroughly alarmed,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: intervenes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we should try for another take.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn needs time to give a great performance. You should give her as long as it takes. Chaplin took eight months to make a movie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eight months of this? I'd rather kill myself. Throughout all this MARILYN herself looks lost. COLIN watches her as she feels the crew's irritable collective gaze. Flustered, she flutters her hands in a calming gesture, then goes to the side of the set to lean on a bar put there for her to rest on (her costume is too tight to allow her to sit down). PAULA accompanies her. MARILYN looks up at her in anguish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't do this. I can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at her adamantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can do it. You can't fail. You will have more pain, you will suffer more but you will create. All you need is time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at her, desperately wanting to believe it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember, Marilyn, a tree is never just a tree. What kind of tree is Elsie? An elm tree? A birch tree?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Under his breath to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God knows, but I'm a weeping fucking willow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think about the things you like, instead of him. Frank Sinatra. Coca Cola. Be specific. The character comes alive if you know what you're doing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: listens intently, a frown flitting across her face. She goes back to her mark. The whole crew is on tenterhooks. Camera running, speed, mark it... Action! Take four.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Well we're still the first ones, aren't we? Gee, this is all right, isn't it?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut. A look of near-panic creeps into Marilyn's eyes at her inability to remember the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 79 The clapperboard snaps one final time. Take twenty three. MARILYN's smile is a grimace of terror. COLIN can hardly bear to look. Everyone holds their breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Well we're still the first ones, aren't we? (Pause) Gee, this is all right too, isn't it?" There is a stunned moment. WATTIS gapes and MARILYN looks around uncertainly. Did she say it? OLIVIER gestures frantically from behind the camera that she should carry on. She hesitates... ... there is an agonising beat... ... and then she panics and bolts for the side of the set.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paula!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut. What's the matter now? He takes her arm and whisks her away to the side of the set, lowering his voice, trying to conceal his exasperation with a honeyed tone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forgive me, Marilyn. This is my failure, not yours. Tell me how I can help you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know who Elsie is. I can't act her if I don't know who she is!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elsie is all in the script
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't find her. She's not there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you have her precisely, you know her inside out. I'm in awe of your gift. We all are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's not real.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not simply rely on your natural talents?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you saying I don't need to act?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is bewildered by her inability to appreciate her own natural talent - as he sees it. He looks at her in genuine anguish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn, you are the most attractive woman in the world. I'm simply suggesting you be yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to be myself! (Pause) I want to be an actress playing a character.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Trying to be helpful) All you have to do, dear Marilyn, is be sexy. Isn't that what you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: flinches as though slapped. Tension ripples through the set. COLIN watches in dismay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want Lee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've already got Paula, for heaven's sake. I'm the director. Speak to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am only Lee's representative.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's five in the morning in New York.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Her furious scream brings all activity to a halt. She storms off the set with PAULA following. The atmosphere is awful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. OLIVIER'S DRESSING ROOM. 80 DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits brooding savagely in front of his make-up mirror with MILTON GREENE. COLIN unobtrusively fetches whisky and cigarettes for them both as OLIVIER abruptly booms out to himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: now, for ever Farewell the tranquil mind/Farewell content/ Farewell the plumed troop and the big wars/That make ambition virtue O, farewell/Farewell..." (Pause, exasperated) Paula's not an actress. She not a director, not a teacher. Her only talent is buttering up Marilyn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It would be worse if she wasn't around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what would make Marilyn Monroe a real actor? A season in rep. They wouldn't stand for this kind of nonsense at the Hippodrome in Eastbourne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to be patient with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trying to teach Marilyn how to act is like teaching Urdu to a badger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gives him a look but says nothing. Instead he picks up his bag and opens it. It is stuffed with bottles of pills. He takes one of them, checks the label and puts it in his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I better go see her. She'll need something to help her calm down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: holds the door for him as he goes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (After a second) Pills to sleep, pills to wake up. Pills to calm her down, pills to give her energy. No wonder she's permanently ten feet underwater.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at him tentatively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe she's scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're all scared. It's part of being an actor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you have the training to deal with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns from the mirror to survey him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't buy the little girl lost act if I were you. Though heaven knows it's tempting. He sighs wistfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I think Marilyn knows exactly what she's doing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: isn't so sure but wisely holds his tongue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better get over to Parkside and make sure the poor girl's all right. (Pause) And Colin? Don't forget who you work for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. DRIVE. NIGHT. 81 COLIN draws up outside Marilyn's house. The place is dark and quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. DRAWING ROOM NIGHT. 82 ROGER takes two bottles of beer from the well stocked drinks cabinet and hands one to COLIN, putting a coaster for him on the coffee table. COLIN looks around the opulent drawing room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure they won't mind?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help yourself. They can spare it. (Pause) Marilyn's okay. She's taken some pills and gone to bed. He frowns darkly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They like to keep her doped up. It makes her easier to control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean Miller?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Shakes his head) The others. They're terrified their cash cow will slip away. He smiles grimly and raises his beer bottle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cheers!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. DRAWING ROOM. NIGHT. 83 COLIN wakes abruptly from a doze as his empty bottle of beer rolls to the floor. ROGER is fast asleep. COLIN glances at the clock. It is nearly midnight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. UPSTAIRS HALL. NIGHT. 84 COLIN, a little drunk, creeps out of the toilet. The narrow strip of light from the door disappears, leaving the hall in darkness. COLIN inches forward uncertainly. He stops, waiting for his eyes to adjust. The house is totally silent. Then, just as he is about to move, he hears something. Breathing, very close by. Faint but unmistakable. Shallow breaths, like sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is paralysed. A beat, then - A door is flung open along the hall and light floods into the corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is sitting on the carpet leaning against the wall only a few feet away from Colin. She is wrapped in a pink bed-cover and stares directly at him, her expression blank and sedated. By her side is an open spiral bound notebook, its pages closely crammed with handwriting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn. Come back to bed. It's not what you think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She stares at COLIN. It is not even clear she knows he is there. COLIN gazes back at her, paralysed. MILLER's voice comes again, flat and tired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just a few ideas. Writer's stuff. (Pause) Bring back my book and let's get some sleep. Finally MARILYN stirs and closes the notebook. Holding it to her breast and clutching the cover around her shoulders she gets up and goes into the bedroom, closing the door. As the light snaps off COLIN breathes for the first time in what feels like minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. GATE. DAY. 85 COLIN, muffled in his scarf, looks up as Marilyn's car cruises to a halt at the gate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning, Miss Monroe. She is hunched in the back, her hair in a scarf, her face protected by her large sunglasses with PAULA by her side. She doesn't look up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUNDSTAGE. DAY. 86 OLIVIER, DAVID ORTON and COLIN huddle around the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and TECHNICIANS stand around, bored and listless. MILTON appears. They speak in low, urgent tones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's nearly lunch time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She isn't feeling the part.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a light comedy. How much feeling can it possibly require?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give her a few minutes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She can't hide in her bloody dressing room all day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yes she can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at him angrily. He is close to the end of his tether.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go and find out what the hell's going on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. MARILYN'S DRESSING ROOM. 87 DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: knocks softly on the dressing room door. PAULA appears, opening it no more than a crack. She looks out suspiciously, sees it is Colin and turns back into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Colin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: waits a moment then PAULA opens the door wider.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Come in. Marilyn wants to see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at her in surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. MARILYN'S DRESSING ROOM. 88 DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes in. The dressing room is in semi-darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: settles down in the corner. MARILYN lies on a sofa, wearing a bathrobe, her face in shadow. Pill bottles are scattered across the dresser at her elbow. There is a long pause. She sighs softly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How old are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (Pause) Nearly
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You remind us of the young king in the movie. Kind of honest and innocent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not innocent. She turns her head and her beautiful face comes fully into the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your job on this picture?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm the third assistant director. Just a gopher really. Go for this, go for that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're Larry's assistant too. He shrugs awkwardly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What were you doing in my house last night? Did he send you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hesitates. It seems pointless to deny it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was worried about you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you spying on me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Of course not. Why would anyone spy on you? She sighs, and looks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all right, Miss Monroe? He waits hesitantly, but she seems to have drifted off. But then, suddenly, she turns back to him, her eyes huge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colin? Whose side are you on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at her. She looks utterly beautiful and vulnerable in the shadowy light. There is only one answer anyone could give.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yours, Miss Monroe. She rewards him with a brilliant smile, her whole face lighting up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call me Marilyn. He is suddenly overwhelmed by a rush of sympathy. She looks so lost and vulnerable. Perhaps he means it. Perhaps he is on her side now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. DAY. 89 As COLIN walks down through the studio he meets RICHARD WATTIS with PAUL HARDWICK, on their way to wardrobe. WATTIS winks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn's got a new boyfriend. Larry will get jealous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can say that again. He gives a camp laugh. COLIN tries to shrug it off with a lightness he doesn't feel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were in there for ten minutes at least. Plenty of time for a kiss and a cuddle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paula was with us the whole time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The mind boggles, dear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles but his expression freezes as he looks up to see LUCY nearby. She has heard every word of the exchange.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 90 MARILYN is finally back on the set, filming a solo dance routine. Released from the need to remember any words she takes refuge in the physical activity, undulating sexily in her tight white dress in a performance which is gawky, mildly silly and charming all at the same time. The dance is deliberately a little amateurish. Elsie Marina isn't meant to be any sort of superstar. But she radiates joy and innocence and sheer happiness in the dance, and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: captures all this perfectly. Within the scene the actor JEREMY SPENSER, playing Nicky, watches from the doorway. Everyone watches silently from behind the camera. No one can look away, least of all COLIN. It feels like one purely joyful moment in the agony the film has become, and Marilyn is radiant. Even OLIVIER has a reluctant half-smile on his face as he watches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. NIGHT. 91 The stage is empty except for OLIVIER and MILLER. They sit in a pool of light in the cavernous room. COLIN pours whisky for them and then steps back into the shadows. Both men ignore him. He is too unimportant to worry about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leans forward, holding his pipe but not smoking it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dreamed last night I could hear singing. And then I realised it wasn't a dream. There was a male voice choir serenading Marilyn under our window. At two in the morning. It's a circus. A freak show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles but MILLER looks dazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going back to New York for a few days. I need to see my kids. I need a break.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That won't help Marilyn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (After a moment) I can't help her. (Pause) You know what she loves to do most? Sleep. It's what she lives for. Sleep is her demon. He pauses for a second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've disappointed her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at him. MILLER shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She thought I could smash all her insecurities with one magical stroke. That I could make her a new person. He pauses for a second, weighing every word carefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wants me to protect her but I can't. I can't even protect myself. (Pause) She read some notes I made. They were nothing. Just a few ideas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About her? He looks up and nods slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She took them the wrong way. He leaves a long, uneasy pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you do love her? Your new bride and all that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: plays with his whisky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't work. I can't think. (Pause) She's devouring me. Forgotten in the shadows, COLIN listens attentively to every word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. GATE. DAY. 92 Early morning. COLIN sees Olivier's black Bentley cruising towards the gate. VIVIEN LEIGH sits in the back seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Colin darling. You look like Horatio defending the bridge. Are you going to let me in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 93 VIVIEN is doing what amounts to a royal tour. She greets everyone, from the lowest chippie to the Heads of Department with the same flirtatious grace. OLIVIER walks at her elbow. The crew crowd around her. She is easy and relaxed, relishing every second of their attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope Larry isn't making you all work too hard. I know what a dreadful slave driver he can be. She sees ORTON and takes his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: David, he would be lost without you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just doing my job. Tough as he is, he melts visibly. She moves on to JACK CARDIFF, the lighting cameraman, looking at him in mock misery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm getting old, Jack. I need you to work your miracles on me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're more beautiful every year, Vivien. She laughs and turns to COLIN, looking at him severely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, you are looking after Larry like I told you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm doing my best...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: glances away to see MARILYN standing nearby, awkward and excluded. She has come straight from make-up and wears only a towelling robe, slippers and curlers in her hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Compared to VIVIEN she looks frumpish. VIVIEN glides towards her, hands extended.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darling Marilyn! She kisses her on both cheeks and holds her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry tells me you are quite, quite superb. I'm wild with jealousy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, but everyone says you were a wonderful Elsie on stage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I'm too old to play her in the film. Larry was quite brutal about that. You see, the truth is all that matters to him. That's why we all admire him so very much. She glances at OLIVIER with a fluttering laugh. He smiles back with a haunted look in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, I must let you work. I only came to wish you good luck! Goodbye, everyone! The crew press around her. MARILYN watches, feeling more than ever the odd one out. COLIN watches her from the edge of the crowd. She cuts a lonely, vulnerable figure. He is totally preoccupied with her, so much so that when VIVIEN comes up behind him he turns guiltily as though caught out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at him. All her exuberance has vanished and she looks suddenly tired and older. It as though the facade of a beautiful building is beginning to crack. She gazes at him with bitter disappointment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Colin. Not you too. He wants to protest but VIVIEN is already turning away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. VIEWING THEATRE/PROJECTION 94 BOOTH. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pushes open the door to the projection booth. The screen is lit up with the rushes of the scene in The Prince And The Showgirl where a startlingly beautiful MARILYN, in gorgeous close-up, eats caviar and drinks champagne in a toast to the American President.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and VIVIEN stand in the shadows of the projector beam. COLIN freezes in the doorway to the projection booth holding a pile of film cans. VIVIEN is crying abjectly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't think she would be so beautiful. She... shines on that screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shouldn't upset yourself. You are ten times the actress she will ever be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you could see yourself. The way you watch her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's never been anything between Marilyn and me. She laughs hysterically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only because she didn't want you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're imagining things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think I'm a fool? You didn't think the little tart could resist the great Laurence Olivier. She looks at him venomously, a dangerous, unbalanced hatred seething in her expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) But she saw through you, didn't she darling? Take away the actor and what's left of the man? You can't even play the husband properly without a script. (slaps him hard across the face. ) I hope she makes your life hell!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vivien..! She storms out. After a beat, COLIN tentatively enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at COLIN in muted apology.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hasn't been well. There was a baby... she... we... lost it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks down awkwardly. OLIVIER sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (After a pause) Do you have a cigarette, Colin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hurries to offer him one of his "Oliviers". OLIVIER grimaces wryly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not one of those awful things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: finds a woodbine in his other pocket and gives it to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who lights it with a shaking hand. He inhales deeply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vivien's right... I did think I would fall shatteringly in love with Marilyn. What a joke. He looks at COLIN, his feelings raw and exposed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember, boy, when it comes to women you are never too old for humiliation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 95 The set is dressed and the crew are waiting but once again there is no sign of Marilyn. The actors, RICHARD WATTIS and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: amongst them, sit apathetically in full costume, while ORTON stands with his arms folded. Technicians chat or sit idly. As COLIN watches, OLIVIER looks across at MILTON who shrugs hopelessly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. OLIVIER'S DRESSING 96 ROOM/PARKSIDE. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pours whisky for OLIVIER. MILTON comes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn won't shoot today. She's gone back to Parkside. She's upset about Arthur leaving England.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's only going to visit his children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't leave Marilyn alone. She can't handle it. She thinks everyone's going to abandon her. The phone rings. OLIVIER picks with a sudden burst of optimism.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps she's come back. (Into the phone) Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir Laurence? It's Roger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Roger. What's up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is Colin there, Sir? He frowns and looks at COLIN in bewilderment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, he's here. (Pause) It's for you. Puzzled, COLIN takes the phone as OLIVIER stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roger?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: where, to Colin's astonishment MARILYN comes on the line (Roger is not in shot).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colin, why don't you drop by here on your way home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - MILTON recognises Marilyn's voice instantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the heck?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why is Marilyn on the phone to my third fucking assistant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks around helplessly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I'm sure I can do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MARILYN smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Don't tell anyone though. She hangs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : COLIN replaces the phone in its cradle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and OLIVIER stare at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well? What did she want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wants to see me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He shrugs awkwardly. MILTON looks at OLIVIER in panic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He shouldn't be talking to her. He's just a kid. Supposing he says something? (Pause) Why the hell didn't she call me? His angry - and jealous - frustration is in stark contrast to OLIVIER, who looks at COLIN with a new interest, wondering if there is anything in this odd situation that can work to his advantage. He smiles calmly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure Colin knows what he's doing. Don't you, Colin? There is a warning as well as approval in his tone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. DRAWING ROOM. DAY. 97 ROGER leads COLIN into the formal drawing room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss Monroe said for you to wait. She won't be long. He looks at COLIN dubiously as he goes out. COLIN is nervous and not quite sure what to do with himself. He looks at the drinks in their decanters on the sideboard and is suddenly desperate for some Dutch courage. He finds the brandy and picks it up -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help yourself to a drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wheels in surprise. MARILYN stands in the doorway, casually but beautifully dressed in silk trousers and a pale cream shirt. COLIN looks guiltily at the brandy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was just... checking you've got everything you need. She walks to the sideboard, standing only a few inches away from him. He can't take his eyes from hers. He drops his gaze, only to find himself staring at her breasts. He looks up again sharply but not before she notices. She takes the decanter from his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, let me. She pours some brandy into a glass and gives it to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you frightened of me, Colin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Because I like you. Colin doesn't know what to say. MARILYN gazes at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to help me. Will you do that? She looks at him, her eyes wide. COLIN feels himself sinking into her gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm only the third. Just a messenger, really.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you know what's going on. You can see both sides of the situation. He shrugs in helpless agreement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to be honest. Tell me everything. She indicates a chair and COLIN perches on it awkwardly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relax. I thought you weren't scared of me. (Pause) Are you hungry? I'll have them send in a tray. I'm starved. He doesn't know how to reply and Marilyn misreads his silence. Her eyes widen in dismay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, gee, I'm sorry. Am I interrupting something? Maybe you have a Mrs. Colin waiting for you at home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no Mrs. Colin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we can talk as long as we like? He nods uncertainly. She frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why is Sir Olivier so mean? He talks to me as if he's slumming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hesitates then decides to throw caution to the wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you what's wrong. It's agony for him because he's a great actor who wants to be a film star, and agony for you because you're a film star who wants to be a great actress. And this film won't help either of you. He stops, breathless, knowing he has gone to far. She stares at him, wide-eyed with surprise. Horribly self- conscious he takes a too large swig of his brandy, reddens and coughs. She laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure you can handle that? You don't look old enough to drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm 23, Miss Monroe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Marilyn. (Pause) I'm 30. I guess that makes me an old lady to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seven years is nothing. She smiles then sits opposite him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know I've been married three times already? How did that happen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were just looking for the right man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They always look right at the start. She smiles wistfully. Her presence is overwhelming. The silence stretches for a second, pregnant with strange possibilities. Suddenly the phone rings, making him jump. Automatically he picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. PRODUCTION OFFICE. DAY. 98 MILTON sits at his desk. He leans forward anxiously at the sound of Colin's voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colin? Is everything okay? What did she want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. DRAWING ROOM. DAY. 99 COLIN looks at MARILYN and hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything's fine. Miss Monroe just had... some large packages she needed handling... He looks at MARILYN's voluptuous figure. MARILYN looks back innocently and mouths the word "packages". She giggles. He turns crimson with the effort of trying to suppress his own laughter but MARILYN isn't helping. She teasingly makes shapes in the air of just how large the packages might be. He covers the phone, agonised, before they both collapse in irrepressible laughter. COLIN finally pulls himself together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? Milton? There is a long silence at the other end of the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. PRODUCTION OFFICE. DAY. 100 MILTON turns pale. When he speaks again his anger is just barely under control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me speak to her, Colin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. DRAWING ROOM. DAY. 101 COLIN offers the phone to MARILYN but she shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's tied up right now. This only sets MARILYN off again. She howls with laughter and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: can't help joining her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. PRODUCTION OFFICE. DAY. 102 MILTON stares at the phone in disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going on? Colin! (Shouts) Let me talk to her, damn it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. DRAWING ROOM. DAY. 103 COLIN looks at MARILYN but she shakes her head between giggles. He turns back to the phone, barely able to get the words out between snorts of laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Milton. I have to go. He hangs up quickly. They both laugh helplessly. MARILYN smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's walk in the garden. See if we can find any more reporters in the bushes. She giggles. COLIN's heart contracts as she casually takes his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. GARDEN. DAY/DUSK. 104 There is a golden glow on the horizon as the sun sinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a cardigan around her shoulders, walks along the path. COLIN is at her side, acutely aware of her physical closeness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know it was so pretty out here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should get out more. See the sights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am the sights. She giggles again, her mood lighter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at us. We're just like Elsie and the young King. What would Sir Laurence say if he could see us now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think he'd mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: grows reflective. She takes COLIN's arm in a friendly way as they walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanted to be an artist. To grow as an actor. I was so proud to be working with the great Olivier. (Pause) Now he thinks I'm the enemy. She looks at him innocently. COLIN hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He doesn't understand your kind of actor. He's hated the method ever since Vivien worked with Elia Kazan. It's all too new and strange. You're the future, and it frightens him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every time I walk into the studio I feel this sense of doom come over me. He looks at me like he's smelling a pile of rotten fish. And the crew hate me. Paula is the only person I can trust. (Pause) Except for you now, maybe. She looks at him, her eyes huge. COLIN feels his senses swim as he stares into them... ... and then ROGER suddenly appears on the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phone call for you, Miss Monroe. It's Mr. Miller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: goes back up the path towards the house, glancing back briefly at Colin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodbye, Colin. Thanks for telling me the truth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares after her. It is a second before he realises that ROGER is gazing at him sternly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll be leaving now, I expect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. OLIVIER'S DRESSING ROOM. 105 DAY. The next morning. COLIN walks in as OLIVIER is talking to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care if he fucks her sideways. Perhaps it'll calm her down. (Pause) Oh, hello, boy. He smiles cheerfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hear you spent last night with Marilyn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't spend the night with her. We just had a chat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard them chuckling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: offers COLIN a lewdly suggestive grin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps if Colin is very diplomatic Marilyn is more likely to behave herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She just wants a chum, that's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A chum? Jesus Christ, what is this, Goodbye Mr. Chips? Grow up, kid. He barges out of the room, slamming the door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: checks the effect of his Grand Duke in the mirror and sighs abruptly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought working with Marilyn would make me feel young again. But I look dead in the rushes. Dead behind the eyes. He gazes at himself thoughtfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps I'm angry with her because in my heart I know my own career is in a terrible rut. I wanted to renew myself through her but all I see reflected in that magnificent face is my own inadequacy. He leans back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I admire Marilyn. I really do. Despite her behaviour. She has taken everything Hollywood can throw at her and triumphed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: waits, uncertain why OLIVIER is confiding in him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An actress has to be pretty tough to get even a tenth as far as she has. He glances up at COLIN in the mirror, shrewd and sympathetic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But be careful, boy. She doesn't need to be rescued. Not really.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 106 Gossip is always fast to travel but on a film it goes at the speed of light. As COLIN arrives on the set he is greeted with wolf whistles and jeers by RICHARD WATTIS, PAUL HARDWICK and the crew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was Marilyn like then, Col?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Going over her lines with her, were you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will she be in today or is she too tired? It is all good-natured stuff but COLIN feels strangely protective, not so much on his own behalf as Marilyn's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was just being friendly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll bet. There are hoots of laughter. COLIN retreats to a corner only to find RICHARD WATTIS pursuing him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ever heard of the Venus Fly Trap? There you are, Colin the innocent little fly buzzing about happily, when suddenly a heavenly scent attracts you and - Snap!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, fuck off, Dickie. You've never slept with a woman in your life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know a Femme Fatale when I see one, love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 107 A brief hiatus in filming. COLIN looks on uneasily as
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: resting against her lean-to, has her costume attended to by LUCY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three minutes, ladies and gents. Three minutes. It has just dawned on COLIN that he has missed his date with LUCY. Before he can react he is jerked violently behind the scenery and pushed up against the wall by an angry MILTON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur Miller called me. He's not happy with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He doesn't even know who I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn must have said something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe she was trying to make him jealous...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns around frowning furiously at the voices behind the set. MILTON pushes COLIN off the set ahead of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STUDIO. DAY. 108 MILTON turns bitterly on Colin as soon as they are outside the studio door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, kid, I've known Marilyn for seven years. I fell in love with her, just like you've done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is about to protest but MILTON ignores him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We had ten days together and that was it. She picked me up, she put me down. That's what she does. She breaks hearts. She'll break yours. My advice to you is to quit before you get burned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't need your advice. And I'm not in love with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, have it your way. (Pause) You don't see Marilyn again, you don't even talk to her. She is completely off-limits to you. Got it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. CORRIDOR. DAY. 109 COLIN hurries along the corridor, looking for LUCY, who he sees pushing a rack of clothes. He stops awkwardly. She gazes at him meaningfully, hurt and puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I waited for you on Friday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, God... I'm sorry... I forgot... I've just been so busy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know how crews gossip. There's nothing in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course there isn't. Marilyn Monroe fancying you? Come on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is put out. Up to now he has never fully confronted the possibility of Marilyn wanting him, but he doesn't like the idea being dismissed so lightly. Lucy sees it and her eyes widen in surprise and hurt. Before she can respond MARILYN herself coming towards them in her gown, her hair up in towel, surrounded by PAULA and her MAKE-UP people. She offers him a dazzling smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Colin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles, self-conscious. MARILYN stops and frowns, looking at Lucy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, are you guys dating? That's what I heard. She looks at him expectantly and suddenly his growing fantasy that she might actually be interested in him kicks in hard. He shrugs casually.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course not. You know how crews like to gossip. His voice trails off lamely as he realises he is repeating what he has just said to Lucy. MARILYN smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too bad. You look cute together. She walks off with her retinue. There is a long pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks up to see LUCY staring at him in dismay. There are sudden tears in her eyes, which she wipes away angrily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you were different.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucy, I really like you. We've had such fun...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now it's time to set your sights a little higher. I get it. (Pause) Who do you think you are, Cary Grant? She shoves the rack of clothes back towards the wardrobe department. Part of him knows he should go after her, but in the end he just stays where he is. He can't help feeling an unworthy sense of relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DOG AND DUCK PUB. COLIN'S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 110 COLIN crosses to the mean little bed on its iron frame and collapses on it gratefully. The noise of the rowdy pub floats up through the floorboards. He covers his ears with his hands then folds the pillow over his head in a desperate attempt to block it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. DAY. 111 The studio is quiet at the weekend. COLIN walks along, snatching a moment for a cigarette. As he reaches the doors to the editing suites a battered old Wolsey draws up beside him. ROGER SMITH is at the wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at him in confusion. The studio doors open and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: emerges. He glances darkly at COLIN and ROGER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any problem, Roger?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just dropped by to take Colin out to lunch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks surprised. MILTON notices. COLIN stubs out his cigarette and hurries to the passenger door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not taking him to Marilyn? That would drop us all in a whole ocean of shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sees a bulky blanket on the back seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you have in there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a picnic. We've been looking forward to it, haven't we, Colin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at him, bemused. He gets in quickly. MILTON frowns but shrugs and walks off with a wave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, well, have a nice time boys. Inside the car COLIN looks at ROGER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is she okay? In the same moment MARILYN herself erupts from under the blanket in the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Jesus - She laughs, looking wonderfully naughty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roger and I decided to take you out for an adventure. Didn't we Roger?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Indeed we did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, God. If Milton sees me with you... I'll be sacked... He tries to scramble out but MARILYN hauls him back gleefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one can sack you, Colin. (Pause) Except me, of course. She pats the seat next to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like being on my own in the back. Before COLIN can respond he sees the curious MILTON running back, having spotted MARILYN in the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell? He peers into the back window. MARILYN screams and buries herself back under the blanket. COLIN scrambles to get over into the back seat while ROGER stamps on the accelerator and the car roars off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colin! Get back here, you little bastard! You're fired! Do you hear me? Fired!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: winces. ROGER looks at him sympathetically. MARILYN emerges from under the blanket, tousled and laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think he saw me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: can't help laughing. He finally tumbles into the back seat with MARILYN as the car speeds away. She scoots up to make room for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Snuggle up. This is fun. She threads her arm through his. He gazes down at their hands meshed together. ROGER's disapproval registers in the faintest flicker of his eyes. In the background the defeated and frustrated MILTON watches the car speed away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WINDSOR GREAT PARK. DAY. 113 COLIN and MARILYN walk barefoot in the grass of Windsor Great Park while ROGER leans on the bonnet of the parked Wolsey, holding shoes, socks, and sandals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There is no one else around. The wind sighs and the grass is pleasantly warm underfoot. MARILYN turns her face up to the sun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is how I ought to feel every day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles. Impulsively MARILYN hugs him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's run away together. He turns ashen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just kidding. She looks around happily. COLIN smiles at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have today, anyway. One day to do whatever we like. We can go back to real life tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only one day?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, maybe the weekend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or a week? He grins. She takes his hand, walking contentedly at his side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What shall we do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We could go to Windsor Castle, if you like. MARILYN's face breaks into a smile of pure delight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WINDSOR CASTLE. GRAND DRIVE. DAY. 114 The car makes its stately progress down the magnificent drive towards the castle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROGER'S CAR. WINDSOR CASTLE. DAY. 115 ROGER has parked up by the sentry post at the entrance to the castle. There are two uniformed POLICEMEN on duty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods to the policemen, who instantly recognise one of their own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Detective Chief Superintendant Smith. I'm escorting this lady and gentleman for the day. They'd like to look around the castle. As the policemen see MARILYN their eyes widen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ, is that..? He stares in disbelief. ROGER smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it's not Diana bloody Dors, is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (After a second) Does she know anyone here, sir? We need to write down a contact name in the book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks stumped at this. He turns to Marilyn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know Her Majesty, by any chance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We met at a movie premiere. She said my dress was pretty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure that quite...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My Godfather works here. He's the Royal librarian, Sir Owen Morshead. The POLICEMAN looks sceptically at Colin's casual clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clark. Colin Clark. The POLICEMAN retreats into his box. We hear him talking on the telephone. ROGER looks at COLIN. He shrugs sheepishly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My father knows everybody. A moment later the policeman returns, looking surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says to go straight up the hill, sir. You'll be met at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WINDSOR CASTLE. CORRIDORS. DAY. 115A COLIN and MARILYN are led by a FOOTMAN down the long corridor. MARILYN looks awed by the ancient suits of armour standing regally along the way. COLIN watches her, enjoying her reaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WINDSOR CASTLE. GOLDEN CORRIDOR. DAY. 115B COLIN and MARILYN are led into another corridor, this one with a beautiful gold-leaf ceiling decoration. MARILYN looks up, enchanted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WINDSOR CASTLE. ROYAL LIBRARY. DAY. 116 The library is a series of magnificent rooms lined from floor to ceiling with books and prints. Every surface is covered with important documents - the place is a shrine to antique learning and culture. SIR OWEN MORSHEAD (63), the Queen's librarian, is a pleasantly eccentric figure with a sly wit. He greets COLIN with a friendly, distracted air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colin, my boy! Come in, come in. Forgive the dust. He smiles at MARILYN, showing no sign whatever of recognising her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are pretty, my dear. I'm sure you and Colin have so much in common.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks around in awe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gee, I'd love to read all these books some time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luckily one doesn't really have to. A lot of them just have pictures in. He finds a portfolio on the table and opens it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These are by an artist called Holbein.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles at a portrait of a young woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was the daughter of one of the King's courtiers, nearly 400 years ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope I look that good when I'm
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: laughs. He takes down another folder of drawings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And these are all by Leonardo Da Vinci.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've heard of him! Didn't he paint that lady with the funny smile? She looks at him, wide-eyed, playing up to her image as the dizzy blonde. In fact she knows exactly who Da Vinci is, and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is tactful enough to acknowledge it gracefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mona Lisa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have that one here too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alas, that one got away. He closes the portfolio and takes MARILYN's arm briskly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, let's go to the Queen's apartments. She's not here at the moment, but she will be sorry to have missed you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at him, wide-eyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yes. Why, she was only saying to me the other day, "what must it be like to be the most famous woman on earth"? He shares a sly smile with COLIN. He knows exactly who Marilyn is and is enjoying every second of her company. He leads her out, with COLIN trailing in their wake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some of the rooms are very opulent but I think there's something you might like better than all that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WINDSOR CASTLE. DOLLS' ROOM. DAY. 118 OPEN on a massive dolls' house. Everything imaginable is inside - beds, chairs, baths, basins, even small rugs and chandeliers, all perfectly to scale. MARILYN kneels in front of it, gazing from room to room with childlike joy. It is so big she can lean inside and see the detail in every room. She cries out with joy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, Colin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: kneels at her side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I sure never had a dolls' house like this when I was a kid. She sees a perfect doll family inside, husband, wife and two children. She points at them, her eyes shining.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is me, that's you, and these are our kids. She smiles wistfully and puts her hand on his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our daughter's so pretty. All little girls should be told how pretty they are. They should grow up knowing how much their mother loves them. Her eyes fill with sadness for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We look like such a happy family, don't we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She turns to him. They are only inches away from each other. COLIN's heart lurches. MORSHEAD coughs discreetly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mustn't let me keep you. I'm sure you're longing to be on your way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WINDSOR CASTLE. COURT YARD. DAY. 119 COLIN and MARILYN emerge. A small crowd of POLICEMEN, SERVANTS and CASTLE WORKERS has gathered. There are cheers as they see her. COLIN looks nervously at MARILYN but she smiles and winks at him, mocking herself gently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shall I be "her"? She jumps up onto a step and strikes a pose - hip out, shoulders back, bosom thrust forward, the classic Marilyn "look". The delighted crowd bursts into cheers. COLIN stands proudly nearby, content to watch Marilyn being a star, basking in the certain knowledge that she will be leaving with him. One of the spectators turns to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you somebody, mate?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm no one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at MARILYN. She catches his eye and smiles, just for him. He feels like he's tumbling into the abyss, but no longer cares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. Roger's car pulls up outside Eton College.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ETON COLLEGE. COURTYARD. DAY. 120 COLIN and an astonished MARILYN walk through the school buildings with ROGER a discreet distance behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't a school, it's a palace!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eton is 500 years old. It was founded by King Henry VI.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's like walking through history.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take that room up there. They stop as COLIN points up at a window.
