direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's where the boys were sent if they didn't work hard enough. Where we were whipped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at him in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whipped?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beaten. She looks appalled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd never send my kids away. (pause) How long were you here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five years. But I was sent to boarding school when I was eight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what we do in my family. She smiles at this, looking at him shrewdly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It seems to me that you've had most things pretty easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In one way, yes. But when you're brought up in a house of over- achievers, it's hard to make your own mark. She looks at him, sympathetic but pushing a little harder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So how are you going to do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe it will be in films, but if not, there are so many possibilities out there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds pretty good to me. She smiles warmly, liking him a lot more for his openness. We sense their relationship has moved quietly to a different and deeper level. But before either of them can say anything a SCHOOLBOY turns the corner in his Eton uniform.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He looks up at MARILYN, his mouth hanging open in shock. Then he simply turns and runs, shouting at the top of his voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn! It's Marilyn Monroe!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ETON COLLEGE. COURTYARD. DAY. 121 MARILYN and COLIN are swamped in a joyous mass of Eton students. MARILYN smiles, waves, pouts, even kisses one boy on the cheek. Cheering BOYS hang out of every window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: blows kisses to them all. ROGER has to plunge into the crowd to rescue her. COLIN follows after them with difficulty. MARILYN pauses, jumping on a bench to wave goodbye and blow more kisses to the boys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Work hard, boys! I don't want anyone whipping you! A gawky young teenager near the front shouts out cheekily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can whip me anytime, Marilyn!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: laughs in delight. There are cheers as COLIN escorts her away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THAMES RIVERBANK. DAY. 122 ROGER leans back against the car, smoking calmly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THAMES RIVERBANK. DAY. 123 After the riotous excitement of the Eton schoolyard the peace and quiet of the river. MARILYN rushes along the sandy bank. The water glitters magically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry up, slow poke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we haven't got any... He stops in mid-sentence as he sees MARILYN unbuttoning her blouse and throwing it off carelessly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He tears his eyes away from her as she casually strips her clothes off. He hurries to find a bush to get changed behind. As he ducks down behind it he hears a splash and MARILYN's cry of shock as she hits the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my gosh! It's freezing!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THAMES. DAY. 124 MARILYN swims in the water, humming softly to herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wades in, wincing at the cold. She laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if a boat goes past? We could be arrested.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. Roger will fix it. Oh, darn it... She holds her head and he looks at her with concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have something in my eye. He swims across to her, very aware of her naked body under the water. She holds her head up to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't see anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get closer. She tips her head back. He looks deep into her eyes - and suddenly she grabs him and kisses him on the lips. Before he can respond she laughs playfully and swims away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the first time I've kissed anyone younger than me. There's a lot of older guys in Hollywood. She swims happily, totally relaxed. COLIN is much more self- conscious, keeping one nervous eye open for pleasure boats. Finally she swims back into the shallows and wades to the shore. She glances back, catching Colin looking. He glances away, embarrassed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be shy, Colin. It's nothing you haven't seen before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wades awkwardly to the shore, trying to conceal his erection with his cupped hands. MARILYN giggles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Colin! And you an old Etonian! He grins. She reaches for her blouse and stands shivering as she tries to dry herself. COLIN goes to take her in his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me warm you up. She snuggles into him gratefully, her teeth chattering. He rubs her naked back briskly, her thin blouse the only barrier between their bodies. Slowly his embrace becomes more sensual, his hands slowing, stroking rather than rubbing, his face buried in her hair, his arms pulling her
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't spoil it. She looks at him, her expression knowing but sweet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want this to be the perfect date. He tries to kiss her but she ducks her head away gently, her expression wistful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't had a real date since I was 13 years old. She suddenly looks much younger, her smile a poignant echo of a lost childhood. He steps back politely, allowing her to put on her blouse. As she buttons it, she gazes at him, then impulsively leans forward to kiss him chastely on the lips. The kiss is as sweet and innocent as any 13 year old might wish. The kiss lasts for a few seconds, their lips touching gently, the river shimmering magically in the sunshine behind them. When they finally break apart she rewards him with a radiant smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was nice. I don't get kissed much. She looks wistful for a second but quickly brightens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, what do we do now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at her, knowing it is time to return to the real world but reluctant to face it. There is a discreet cough and ROGER appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time to go home, I think, Miss Monroe. She smiles, a little sadly, then gets up, walking past him as she puts on the rest of her clothes. ROGER averts his eyes respectfully and waits for COLIN. The two men look at each other for a second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be careful not to get in too deep, son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: knows he isn't talking about the river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROGER'S CAR. DAY. 125 MARILYN and COLIN sit in silence in the back of the car. Her exuberance has vanished and there is a distant look in her eye. COLIN wants to say something but can't think of the right words. He puts his hand on hers and she squeezes it, but then pulls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. ROGER'S CAR. DAY. 126 A seething MILTON is waiting on the steps as ROGER parks the car. COLIN looks at him nervously. MARILYN looks at him then gets out, glancing at Milton indifferently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi Milton. She smiles sweetly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Next time I come on set, you better make sure Colin is there. He looks at her in shock then bitterly at COLIN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take him home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She waves briefly to Colin, nothing more than a flutter of her fingers. COLIN watches her all the way up the steps until she disappears inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 127 The crew are ready, the cast stand around in full costume,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: paces the set - and there is no sign of Marilyn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns to COLIN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You spent the day with her. What frame of mind was she in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, find out what's going on. There's a good chap. Perhaps we can persuade her on this splendid day to do the work she's paying herself to do. He stalks off. COLIN sees WATTIS grinning at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't start, Dicky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't get any sympathy from me, dear. Frankly I wouldn't care if Marilyn dropped dead tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's trying her best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's Marilyn Monroe. This is her life. Pills, booze, sex, more pills. (Pause) God, it must be wonderful!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: doesn't laugh. WATTIS looks at him sympathetically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, dear. Little Colin's in love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. DRIVE. DAY. 128 MILTON is waiting for COLIN at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn's not well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But she was wonderful yesterday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at him for a long moment, masking his hostility in barbed politeness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what you did to her, kid, but she got nervous. I had to give her some pills to calm her down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She doesn't need pills! She just needs someone to care for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone like you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: reddens. MILTON shakes his head patronisingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you, I'm not in love with her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You kissed her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She said that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spare me the bullshit. I know everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at him, feeling hopelessly out of his depth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You messed her up, kid. Confused her. He comes very close, his tone fierce but wounded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got every penny I ever made tied up in Marilyn. She owes me. If it wasn't for me she'd still be on contracts that make slave wages look good. I gave her back her freedom, and now Miller's turning her against me. That's what you get for trying to help Marilyn Monroe. He goes back to the house, pausing at the door, speaking more in sorrow than anger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you want to play with the grown-ups, Colin, start learning the rules.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PUB. COLIN'S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 129 A gentle summer breeze lifts the net curtains. COLIN is fast asleep. There's a sharp rap at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colin! (Pause) Colin!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: opens his eyes, his mind drugged with sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roger? What's the matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Marilyn. A cold dread clutches at COLIN's stomach. He stumbles out of bed and opens the door. ROGER stands in the doorway
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is she dead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's asking for you. She's sick. I think she might be in a coma.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can she be asking for me if she's in a coma?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just bloody get dressed!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. DRIVE. NIGHT. 130 ROGER and COLIN drive up. MILTON, waits on the steps. He looks resentfully at COLIN but doesn't say anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. MARILYN'S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 131 PAULA STRASBERG paces frantically outside Marilyn's bedroom door as ROGER, MILTON and COLIN hurry up the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hasn't made a sound for over an hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should break down the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many pills did she take?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Jesus, who knows? I wasn't counting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: knocks gently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn? There is no reply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. GARDEN. NIGHT. 132 ROGER and COLIN carry a ladder across the moonlit gravel and prop it up against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's her window. He points with his torch. The window is open. COLIN shins up the ladder while ROGER holds it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll open the door once I'm inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE. MARILYN'S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 133 COLIN tumbles in through the window with a clattering thump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn? A shaft of moonlight reveals MARILYN lying naked across the bed, her body partly covered by the sheet. Half empty pill and champagne bottles are scattered all over her dresser; there is also an old photograph in a silver frame of her mother Gladys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn? For a second he fears the worst, but then suddenly she groans and sits up, looking at him blearily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh hi, Colin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay? Everyone was worried about you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phooey. She pats the sheets at her side and settles down sleepily on the pillow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get in. She is instantly back asleep. COLIN fumbles his way to the door. He searches for the key on the side table and quickly finds it. He goes to unlock the door, but then pauses, looking back at Marilyn. He puts the key back and bends down to whisper at the keyhole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's me. She's fine but I'm going to keep an eye on her. I'll sleep on the sofa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Colin, open up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (After a second) I can't find the key. (Pause) You can all go to bed now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colin, open this door! She needs me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: goes back to the bed and gazes at the sleeping Marilyn, his expression suffused with a tenderness we have never seen in him before. He pulls up the sheet so that it covers her nakedness, then tentatively lies down to rest his head on the pillow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE. MARILYN'S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 134 COLIN wakes with a jolt as the light snaps on, blinding him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colin? What are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits up, the sheet clutched to her chest, her expression panicky and disoriented. COLIN hurls himself off the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came in through the window... He realises this doesn't sound reassuring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Milton thought you were sick. She stares at him in puzzlement then breaks into a dazed smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The window? Is there a balcony, like in Romeo And Juliet? How romantic. (Pause) But I'm not sick. What makes them think that? She reaches instinctively for the pill container on her bedside table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please don't take any more pills. She frowns, clutching the pill bottle in one hand. He reaches out and prises it gently from her grasp. As he puts it back on the side he glances at the framed photograph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Who's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mom. Her expression softens as she looks at the picture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They took her to the Sanatorium when I was a kid. I grew up in other people's homes, mostly. Alongside her mother's photo is another framed picture, this time of Abraham Lincoln. COLIN frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abraham Lincoln?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know who my father is so it might as well be him. Why not? I can pick any father I want. She smiles, then looks at Colin wistfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have a home, Colin? A real one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And a mother and father who still live together?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And do they love you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure they do. He nods. She smiles sadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're lucky. Her eyes fill with tears. She looks up at him anxiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you love me, Colin? He stares at her. She looks lovely but desperately vulnerable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. She reaches for the pills and pours three or four into her palm. COLIN gently takes her hand and takes two of them away. She smiles, not objecting as he settles her back gently on the pillow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you and I come from different worlds. You're like some Greek Goddess to me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not Greek. She smiles, teasing him. He smiles back. She takes his hand, looking at him in appeal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to be a Goddess. I just want to be loved like an ordinary girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Miller loves you. She stares at him, her face going blank with misery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I found his notebook. It said I'd let him down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Writers scribble all kinds of things. It doesn't mean anything. She looks at him, her eyes full of pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wanted me to find it. It said he should never have married me. That I was unpredictable and a woman-child, flighty and self- centred. He's left me, Colin. Why do the people I love always leave me? She looks so wretched, so completely baffled, that COLIN responds with sudden passion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll never leave you. She smiles and embraces him gratefully. She sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All people ever see is Marilyn Monroe. As soon as they realise I'm not her, they run. He lies down next to her, taking her awkwardly in his arms. She sighs sleepily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy, there's a lot of men in this business. And they all think you've got to sleep with them. She looks across at him, their faces inches apart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not like that. That's why I like you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares back at her guiltily. She smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should date that Wardrobe lady. She's pretty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to. (Pause) I love you, Marilyn. She stares at him and tears gather in her eyes again. They stare intently at each other, their mood fragile, touched with both sensuality and a longing for something less tangible. MARILYN leans forward and kisses him gently. The embrace grows in passion and they kiss properly, hungrily. He kisses her eyes and her face and she sighs happily. He wants her more than he has wanted anything before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . And then he stops. The fantasy he has been pursuing for weeks is within his grasp but he knows that whatever it does for him it will only damage her further. He pulls away from her gently. Her eyes flicker open lazily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter? Don't you want to make love?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we should just be friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Friends. She wraps herself around him, curling up so their bodies cradle each other like spoons in a cutlery draw. As she buries her head in his neck he feels her breasts against his back. She curls against him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is nice. Like spoons. I used to do this with Johnny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's Johnny?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Johnny Hyde. My agent, back in the old days. He was thin, like you... Her voice is blurred and drifting with sleep. With her body warm against him COLIN's resolve nearly snaps but he is clear eyed now and determined.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn? She mutters softly in reply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do one thing for me? Come into the studio on time tomorrow and show everybody what you can do. Show Larry you're a great actress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. He smiles and turns out the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE. MARILYN'S BEDROOM/BATHROOM. DAY. 135 First light streams in through the curtains. COLIN wakes to hear Marilyn singing cheerfully. He gets up and sees her through the open door of the bathroom sitting in the bath, her back towards him. She is practicing the gentle waltz tune she is to sing in the film.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: found a dream and lay in your arms the whole night through... I'm yours no matter what others may say or do... She has never sounded so happy or carefree. COLIN smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. GATE. DAY. 136 COLIN races up the road and arrives panting at the gate a few seconds before OLIVIER's car swings into the entrance. The great man leans out of the back window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning, boy. (Pause) Christ, you look rough. He looks at him thoughtfully, then shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me know when Marilyn arrives. If she ever does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I'm pretty sure she'll be in this morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gives COLIN an odd look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 137 MARILYN, OLIVIER and WATTIS act a scene together; a drunken Elsie Marina is being seduced by the Grand Duke, and Northbrook bursts in to interrupt them as a VALET plays the violin in the doorway behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Your Grand Ducal Highness.."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "This is intolerable"!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "With the deepest respect, sir, my message was so important I had no choice but to intrude".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Revolution?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "No, sir, Miss Marina's aunt has been in a motor accident. The hospital is calling for her most urgently."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "What? (Giggles drunkenly) Oh, go away, you silly man."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Miss Marina, your aunt... you realise how serious her condition is?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Well, it's her own fault. She has no right being out at this time of night. She's 93!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is utterly adorable. The crew, COLIN, amongst them, can't take their eyes off her. OLIVIER glances at ORTON behind the camera. They have a good take and they know it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut it there!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is as happy as we have ever seen her. She seeks out
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: amongst the crowd and beams at him. Half the crew, including OLIVIER, notice the look. COLIN blushes self- consciously but we can feel his pride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. OLIVIER'S DRESSING ROOM. 138 NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: takes off his make-up. COLIN stands behind him with the end of day bottle of whisky. OLIVIER is in buoyant mood. It has been a good day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever it was you did to her, boy, keep doing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: grins slyly and COLIN doesn't bother to protest. The phone rings. OLIVIER picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? His face falls as he listens to the voice at the other end of the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. HALL. NIGHT. 139 COLIN paces nervously up and down the hall. PAULA appears. She looks at him for a long, unnerving moment then speaks with sudden ferocity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From the first moment all I have felt is Olivier's loathing and contempt. He thinks I'm unnecessary. Me, her drama coach, surrogate mother, nursemaid. On call 24 hours a day to help her act, dole out pills, bolster her ego, keep her sober enough to work. (Pause) Me. Unnecessary. (Pause) No me, no Marilyn. He is taken aback by her passion. She smiles bitterly then walks on. COLIN hesitates. She looks back briefly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can come up now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. MARILYN'S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 140 MARILYN lies in bed with MILTON possessively at her side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes in with PAULA. MARILYN looks at him dully, her eyes clouded and unfocused. A half empty pill bottle stands on the side. COLIN sits down next to her and she takes his hand, ignoring the surprised look on Milton's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I can act, don't you, Colin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course I do. You were wonderful today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at MILTON, then moves between them busily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn's tired now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want him to stay with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What would Arthur say if he knew Colin was here? A flicker of terror crosses MARILYN's face. COLIN turns on them angrily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard what she said. She wants me here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at him grimly but finally surrenders the field. Paula is more reluctant to give in. She sits on the bed, stroking Marilyn's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have no idea of your position in the world, Marilyn. You are the greatest actress there's ever been. Not just actress. The greatest woman of this or any time. I love you like a daughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is surprised to see tears in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's hard now, but believe me you will survive this and go on to better things. Your life is ahead of you. You're young, just beginning. Paula's love and sincerity are obvious. She means it. COLIN watches her in silence. MARILYN squeezes her hand and PAULA gets up with a heavy sigh, bitterly reluctant to leave. Finally she drags herself out, leaving them alone. As the door closes MARILYN curls herself up in the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so tired of feeling scared. Life is so shitty. I hate it. It hurts too much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at her, his heart breaking at her anguish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here now. I'll look after you. She gives him a wry look, teasing but thoughtful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good old Colin. Looking after me, looking after Larry, looking after Vivien. Always putting everyone before yourself. There is an edge to this. He gazes at her, shaken, but she smiles and touches his face gently. He gets on the bed, fully clothed, to fold her in his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. MARILYN'S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 141 COLIN wakes with a start as he realises that MARILYN is screaming in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It hurts! It hurts, Colin! She is doubled up, clutching her stomach, sweating and frightened. COLIN sees a dark red stain on the sheets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The baby. I can't lose the baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at her aghast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a surprise. For Arthur. Don't tell anyone. Promise me. He hurls himself off the bed and runs to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. MARILYN'S BEDROOM/BATHROOM. 142 NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and COLIN wait by the bathroom in Marilyn's suite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hurries in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doctor's coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns the handle but the bathroom door is locked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn, unlock the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't let anyone in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gives him a sharp look but he no longer cares about anything except Marilyn. There is a shuffling sound and the door is unlocked. At the same moment PAULA comes rushing in, hair awry, gown flapping, a wild look in her eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn! Marilyn, my baby, what has Colin done to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't done anything. She's just... got a stomach ache. He reddens with embarrassment. ROGER coughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think he means her monthlies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What will Arthur say if she dies?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's not dying, for Christ's sake. The HOUSEKEEPER now appears at the door with an elderly man at her side. He nods briskly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Dr. Connell. Is the patient in there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please save her... it's Marilyn Monroe. You can't let her die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: calmly extracts himself from her grasp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps you'd all like to give us a little privacy? As COLIN shepherds the others out MILTON turns on him bitterly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happy now, kid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. HALL. NIGHT. 143 DR. CONNELL stands in the hall outside the bedroom writing out a prescription and smoking a cigarette. He tears the prescription off the pad and looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's in charge here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and COLIN all step forward as one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gives them a wry look and shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've given Mrs. Miller an injection and the bleeding has stopped. She needs to stay in bed tomorrow but after that she'll be fine. I suggest someone stays with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leans forward and almost snatches the prescription from his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll be safe with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She looks bitterly at Colin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. NIGHT. 144 COLIN walks CONNELL to his car, their feet crunching on the gravel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, goodnight then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: holds the door open as he gets in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was she really pregnant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think that's a private matter between Mr and Mrs. Miller. He looks at COLIN with cool disapproval, then closes the door and drives off. COLIN stands watching, shivering in his shirtsleeves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKSIDE HOUSE. MARILYN'S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 145 COLIN creeps into the room and sits on the bed. MARILYN is awake. She gazes at him, hazy but lucid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to say goodbye now, Colin. Arthur's on his way back. When this film is over I'm going to settle down and be a good wife to him. I'm going to learn to make Matzo ball soup as good as his dad's. She smiles wistfully at the fantasy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to forget this ever happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to forget. He struggles then suddenly bursts out passionately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me protect you from all this... She smiles sadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want to do? Marry me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not? You could come and live at my parents place. You'd love it. It's a castle, like in a fairy tale. We wouldn't even have to live together. You could have your own suite of rooms... He is close to tears, suddenly looking very young. She looks at him with a sad, sweet smile. He shakes his head stubbornly, taking her hand in passionate appeal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could quit. Forget Marilyn Monroe, forget Hollywood. Let it all go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is what I've worked for my whole life. I couldn't just give it all up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not, when it drives you crazy? Her eyes widen in surprise. A flicker of nervous insecurity dulls her expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I'm crazy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't mean that. I just meant you could be happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am happy. I got everything I ever dreamed about. She smiles tentatively, but he sees a terrible fear in her eyes. He looks down, realising with a cruel stab of pain that Olivier was right. There is no way back. She doesn't want to be rescued. He finally looks up, smiling despite the tears in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course you're happy. (Pause) You're a star. The biggest star in the world. She smiles, reassured. He drags himself off the bed and goes to the door, pausing for a second as he looks back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right, Marilyn. We have to forget all this. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From now on I'm nobody. Just the third. You don't even know I exist. We'll never look at each other again. She giggles with some of her old playfulness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, maybe just a wink. Once in a while. He smiles, looks at her just once more, and then goes out. As the door closes we see Marilyn's smile fade to be replaced by a bleak, frightened expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. OLIVIER'S DRESSING ROOM. 146 DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits in front of his make-up mirror in his Grand Ducal uniform, smoothing down his hair with pomade. COLIN knocks and comes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're ready for you on set, Sir Laurence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marilyn?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's just arrived.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only an hour late. Not bad by her standards. He smiles, then stands up, straightening his uniform.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we will finish this bloody film after all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 147 The crew are ready. The actors are on set. OLIVIER stands by the camera. COLIN is half-hidden in the shadows. There is a flurry of activity and MARILYN emerges, with PAULA on one side and MILTON on the other. She looks exactly as Marilyn should. With her white dress shimmering in the lights and her platinum blonde hair glowing, she has the air of a Goddess. She sweeps past only inches away from Colin but ignores him. He can't help feeling a stiletto sharp pang of regret.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns to the assembled crew. A silence settles. She smiles around, blinking in the lights. She looks for comfort or support among the technicians but sees only blank faces or sullen hostility. She smiles nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope you will all forgive me. It wasn't altogether my fault. I have been ill. She smiles up at their uneasy expressions, struggling to understand herself and their expectations of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like you to remember I tried. This oddly moving and open confession is received in silence. No one quite knows how to react to her lacerating honesty. Perhaps they think it is just another performance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 147A OLIVIER, in character, lies back on a sofa, with MARILYN on top of him, singing the waltz that Colin first heard after his night with her. MARILYN looks kittenish and irresistible as she sings only a few inches from OLIVIER's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "..I found a dream and lay in your arms the whole night through, I'm yours no matter what others may say or do. Be light of heart and fancy free, that's the way to start, there will be nothing to lose till you lose your heart.." She sings with touching delicacy, nailing it perfectly. There is pin drop silence on the set as the crew watch. COLIN is amongst them. It is a moment of almost unbearable poignancy for him. He suddenly realises that SYBIL THORNDIKE has crept up silently behind him to watch the scene. As he turns to her she smiles with infinite wisdom and compassion, murmuring softly so that only he can hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First love is such sweet despair, Colin. She touches his cheek gently and smiles, perhaps lost in a long ago memory of her own, before retreating quietly into the darkness at the back of the set.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 148 Inch by laborious inch The Sleeping Prince moves towards the finish line. We see a montage of scenes being filmed - - HARDWICK enters as Major Domo through the main door of the oval room, carrying a silver tray bearing shaving equipment... - WATTIS and JEREMY SPENSER crossing the drawing room to the Grand Duke's bedroom... - WATTIS crosses the drawing room and knocks on a door... The process is hardly any easier but somehow the work is done, until we come to the final shot in the sequence -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very quiet, studio! Going for a take. The big overhead lights switch on with a series of heavy clunks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Camera running! Speed!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks up, in character as Elsie, her eyes glowing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "My dear..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "I've got a solemn word of warning for you."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "What's that, my beloved?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "You know what's going to happen? I'm going to fall in love with you, because I always, always do."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on MARILYN as she smiles, her face radiating joy and vitality. And then, in the split second before ORTON calls `cut',
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns her head just a fraction and winks at Colin. He grins. OLIVIER looks up from the sofa, notices and smiles indulgently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut! Okay boys and girls, that's a wrap! There is a smattering of applause from the crew. MARILYN leaves the stage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. CORRIDOR. DAY. 148A MARILYN walks away from us, down the long corridor, alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. SOUND STAGE. DAY. 149 The crew shake hands and clap each other on the back like a group of hardened war veterans. ORTON offers COLIN a grudging nod - `well done'. MILTON now comes forward, calling out above the hubbub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you'd all like to step this way, you'll find something I think you'll like.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: indicates a trestle table at one end of the studio, loaded with gaily wrapped parcels. He ushers the crew over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A parting gift to each of you from Marilyn. Men on the left, ladies on the right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . At first there is a buzz of excitement but then something odd happens. One of the crew simply picks up his present without looking at it and drops it in the large bin standing against the wall. There is a moment, then a WOMAN does the same with hers. Suddenly there is a rush for the bin as almost everyone dumps their present. The bin is soon overflowing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at the scene, then simply shrugs and walks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: utterly indifferent to the hostile undercurrent, grins and waves cheerfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's been a lot of fun, kids. See you at the Academy Awards. He goes out, grabbing a discarded bottle of booze from the dustbin as he goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watches all this in shocked silence. He looks at the label on his own small parcel, which reads simply "To Colin, with thanks, Marilyn".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. WARDROBE DEPT. DAY. 150A The wardrobe department is empty except for LUCY, who cradles her own gift from Marilyn. COLIN comes in, looking nervous. They look at each other awkwardly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aren't you going to throw yours away?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course not. It's from Marilyn Monroe. He smiles. She shrugs and turns to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (After a second) Lucy? She turns back to look at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was wondering if you're doing anything this Saturday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm washing my hair. He nods, accepting this as no more than he deserves. She goes but then stops to look back at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did she break your heart?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (After a second) A little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. It needed breaking. There is no malice in her response, just an awareness that he is older and wiser now, and perhaps a better man for the experience. He nods, accepting the rebuke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (After a second) I might be free on Wednesday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles. She goes out. He looks down at Marilyn's present in his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. HALL. DAY. 151 COLIN walks down the hall. He notices the red light is on outside the viewing theatre. As he goes towards it he sees
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: coming the other way on his way out of the studio, his job done. The two men smile; an acknowledgment of everything they've been through together. ROGER offers him a friendly salute and then goes on his way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PINEWOOD STUDIOS. VIEWING THEATRE. DAY. 152 OLIVIER sits on his own, watching an edited version of the "The Coconut Girl" sequence (Scenes 61 and 62). COLIN comes in. OLIVIER glances at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "You do look, my son, in a moved sort/As if you were dismay'd: be cheerful, sir./Our revels now are ended. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These our actors,/As I foretold you, were all spirits and/Are melted into air, into thin air...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prospero.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are such stuff/As dreams are made on, and our little life/Is rounded with a sleep..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits down next to the great man. They watch in silence as another sequence is projected for them. The sequence shows MARILYN improvising in the champagne and caviar scene. She serves herself food and drink before collapsing, drunk. The endless retakes and fluffs gone, what remains is a gifted comic performance by a luminous beauty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (After a second) She's quite wonderful. No training, no craft, no guile, just pure instinct. Astonishing. He seems almost lost in awe. COLIN gazes at him in surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should tell her that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I will. But she won't believe me. That's probably what makes her great. It's certainly what makes her so profoundly unhappy. He smiles wryly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tried my best to change her, but she remains brilliant despite me. (Pause) Directing a movie has to be just about the best job ever invented, but Marilyn has cured me of ever wanting to do it again. He signals to the projection box and the film stops as the lights come up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now I'm going back to the theatre. John Osborne is writing a piece for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you hated all that Royal Court stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miller made me see things differently. (Pause) You have to find new worlds to conquer, if you want to be the best. And believe me, most of the time, I really am the best. He goes to the door and pauses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've done a good job, boy. (Pause) Welcome to the circus. He goes out. COLIN looks back up at the projection box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Run it again, please. The lights go down. MARILYN's face appears on the screen, laughing and happy. It is another sequence, the one where Marilyn does her sweet, uninhibited little dance (Scene
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ), a performance both sexy and yet touchingly innocent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on COLIN for a long moment, gazing at her image in the darkness, then -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DOG AND DUCK PUB. DAY 152A The circus is leaving. The film is shutting down. Not knowing his next job COLIN sits, suitcase next to his chair, wearing the 'Marilyn' experience on his face and in his soul. Head down, sipping a pint. He could be a regular here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: behind the bar, flitting around - the dart players and regulars at play. And then, as if a gust of wind invaded, BARRY looks up and freezes. The DART PLAYER, sensing something, turns to look up as well. The regulars are frozen in mid-action.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is missing it all. 100% of his attention is given to his woe and his pint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buy a girl a drink?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: doesn't turn. He recognizes the voice and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I get another one of those please, Barry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: for once is silent, pours a pint. The regulars try not to stare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't want to leave without saying goodbye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hands COLIN a package.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The first time you saw this, all I had on was the radio. Colin opens the package. It's her copy of the script. On the first page she has written a message scrawled in ink: TO THE MOST CHARMING THIRD ASSISTANT DIRECTOR IN THE WORLD MARILYN (CONT'D) Don't forget me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As if I could.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone else on the picture wishes they could.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone else doesn't understand. She smiles, touched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be a gentleman and walk me to my car?
direction.name: direction

result.heading: TO THE MOST CHARMING THIRD ASSISTANT DIRECTOR IN THE WORLD MARILYN, (CONT'D)

direction.raw_text: . DOG & DUCK PUB. DAY 152B The ever faithful Roger stands by the idling car. COLIN opens the car door for MARILYN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: beckons him closer. She kisses him gently. He smiles and says lightly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's for being on my side; and remember, when you see me wink, that's for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks around the car and looks over at COLIN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (glancing at COLIN) Looking a couple of inches taller than when I first saw you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods at COLIN (a silent salute suggesting job well done.) He gets into the car and we stay on COLIN as he watches it pull away. BARRY comes to the doorway of the pub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was that really Marilyn Monroe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No - just a good friend of mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks back into the pub, leaving COLIN alone, staring at the vanishing car. And then the sun swallows it as it drives into the English countryside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WARDOUR STREET. LONDON. DAY. 153 COLIN walks along chatting to friends. Dressed in a neat dark suit he looks older and more confident. There is little sign left of the callow young man who paced up and down the pavement outside Sir Laurence Olivier's office. We see the caption: SIX YEARS LATER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COLIN'S OFFICE. WARDOUR STREET. DAY. 154 COLIN walks into a small office. Film cans are piled up all over the floor and books and papers spill off the shelves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits typing at her desk. COLIN goes to his own desk, glances at his diary, then looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any messages?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pushes a piece of paper at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's probably just someone having a joke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks down at the message. There is a Los Angeles phone number and then the name - Marilyn Monroe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (After a moment) Did she say anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She just asked you to call. (Pause) It is a joke, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares down at the paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Probably. (Pause) Book a call as soon as you can. Los Angeles, California. Brentwood 1890.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COLIN'S OFFICE. WARDOUR STREET. NIGHT. 155 It is late. COLIN stares at the number on the scrap of paper. The phone rings. He picks it up eagerly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your call to Los Angeles. We hear the crackle of the international line. He waits anxiously as the ringing continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LOS ANGELES. MARILYN'S HOUSE. LIVING ROOM. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the luxurious exterior of Marilyn's comfortable Brentwood house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LOS ANGELES. MARILYN'S HOUSE. LIVING ROOM. 156 DAY. The room is large and tasteful - white sofas and cushions and deep rugs. Picture windows look out onto the Hollywood hills. A white phone rings on the table. It rings continuously, insistently. It carries on ringing. No one comes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the jangling phone. Each time it rings we think Marilyn might appear, but she never does. It carries on ringing, unanswered, in the empty room. As the picture fades we hear like a ghostly lament the sweet echo of Marilyn's voice singing the Sleeping Prince Waltz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "I found a dream and lay in your arms the whole night through, I'm yours no matter what others may say or do. Be light of heart and fancy free, that's the way to start, there will be nothing to lose till you lose your heart..." The fragile voice hangs in the air for a second, then slowly drifts away to nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COLIN'S OFFICE. WARDOUR STREET. NIGHT. 157 COLIN sits with the phone to his ear. The sound of Marilyn singing the Sleeping Prince Waltz dies away and we realise has been revisiting it in his memory. He waits as long as he can but it is obvious no one is going to answer. In the end he puts the receiver back in its cradle in resignation. His gaze drifts up to a shelf stacked with film cans. He stands up and looks through them, blowing dust away; they have been here for a long time, ignored. He finds the one he is looking for - it says simply MM on the can. He takes the short reel of film and threads it through a Movieola in the corner of the room. He turns it on and bends to look. The screen bursts into life with an image of MARILYN at her most vital and captivating. It is a copy of some rushes from The Prince And The Showgirl, perhaps given to Colin by Olivier, or perhaps "borrowed" as a souvenir and long since forgotten. We see MARILYN dancing happily, exaggerating off camera, looking playful and sexy. She is radiant and full of life. After a moment she turns and looks off camera - perhaps to where Colin himself would have been standing - and winks happily. Blown up to the full size of the screen it is utterly sweet and charming. There is something so completely natural about the gesture
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: feels he has been swept back seven years in time and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is standing in front of him again, in the flesh. It moves and delights him; perhaps he has never even really seen this clip before. At any rate he hasn't thought about it for years. It is MARILYN as he will always remember her, relaxed, affectionate and vital, a part of her, however tiny, forever his. She smiles, laughs at something, giggles in delight (without sound). She says something to an unseen crew member, then looks back, smiling at the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Her face fills the screen. Beautiful, timeless - Happy.
direction.name: direction
